We walked in and no one greeted us, then we waiting 10 minutes and some seconds for a server. This is after 2 people came to the table to say our server would be with us soon. Drinks, chips and dip, even water would have been nice as we waited. THEN....we waited again after we got drinks to order our dinner.  But WOW, the food was great. Yes I'd go back. The food rocked!

The 3.5 star rating baffles me.  Maybe people aren't ordering the right menu items.  I come to Phoenix about once a year and usually find a way to eat here 2-3 times.  It's simply the best southwest food I have ever had.  This isn't Mexican, this is southwest.  There is a huge difference.  I several times debated making the 300+ mile drive simply to eat the Carne Adovada and then drive home.  It's that good.  Also, the Carne Adovada Benedict is great for breakfast, the orange juice is fresh squeezed.  I am sure there is also a Carne Adovada Flan that is to die for.  If you can get an appetizer with carne adovada, you should try that too.

For starters, it's dark as hell inside. They never asked if we wanted to be indoors or out. That sucked. Ambience and design is cool. Lots of dark wood, bright copper and adobe. Our server was very good and attentive.  My draught beer was flat but I left it at that. Ordered only one.  I can't stand booth seating unless at a diner so I was somewhat uncomfortable the entire time.  Food was good. I got the tacos ala carte. Pork and the tilapia were very good but the lamb was nasty grizzly.  Rice and beans were tasty and cooked just right.  My one daughter's brick oven pizza was well liked and my other daughter's skewers were great. My wife's shrimp quesadilla was over the top great according to her but she was buzzed! I'd say Richardson's would be an excellent place to bring or meet friends but as for families or business clients, not so.
Great atmosphere, margaritas and New Mexican food .... and free valet!   But tip your valet guy, of course ha!
Very cool atmosphere. Five of us had brunch. Everything was very tasty and the portions were huge.  Would like to go back without kids and enjoy the multiple bars.

This isn't your cheap Mexican food joint around the corner, but it's also not your haute Spanish fusion fine dining. What you get is a relaxed and unpretentious environment, large portions and good food.  Had dinner here with my wife and some friends. It's a good sized space inside, though there can be a wait during peak times. But they have a nice covered patio bar area where you can wait and grab a drink. The portions are huge. My wife and I shared the Carne Adovada and Chimayo Chicken, and probably had a full serving left over to take home. The Carne Adovada has a little kick to it with the red chili sauce, but the smoked pork is succulent and delicious. My wife thought the Chimayo Chicken was a bit too heavy for her liking, but I thought it was delicious. I'm looking forward to the leftovers :-)

Hubs and I didn't have a reservation like we needed to get a good table. Our fault.  So we ended up at the bar, and we were lucky to get those seats; this place fills up fast.   The food is excellent quality authentic.  The ambiance is dark, with only candles for lighting, leather booths that looked really comfy. So make reservations and enjoy.

My friend and I went in for brunch because it was recommended by a few friends and...wow! We both loved it! 5.00 mimosas and bloody Mary's?! So good.  Nothing about Richardsons was lacking. The service was great, the prices are fair for the quality of food and the atmosphere is awesome! Love the copper and dim lighting.  Sunday brunch at Richardsons is my new go-to.  Also, the outside bar is a nice touch and the bartenders are always easy going and creative enough to make you speciality drinks. -I only say this because I am allergic to syrups, but they always seem to substitute the syrups without sacrificing the flavor so I am able to enjoy it!   Definitely get patio seating and ask for Max or Adam !!!! - best service from those two.

This is one of my favorite spots to accompany my wife too. The hammered copper bar top is cool while the ambiance is just plane awesome in this New Mexican cuisine restaurant. We usually start with their Chips, salsa, and guacamole while I get a beer on tap. The wife gets a prickly pear margarita or a glass of wine from their great and reasonably priced wine list.  Although I have tried just about everything in the menu and many of their specials, I find myself going back to the chile rellenos platter. They offer two chiles stuffed with one of their several different stuffings. I like to mix it up and get one topped with red sauce while the other topped with green sauce. My wife is from NM, and she has stated many times that this is by far the best spot in AZ for NM styled food.

First time here and everything has a flavor profile that is very New Mexican authentic. The appetizer, the roasted garlic plate was a leap of faith for me as it sounded like nothing I would normally order but I was feeling a bit on the adventurous side. When it arrived I was not only surprised, my taste buds were blown away. I highly recommend the plate when you have about 4 of your friends or family to assist in taking that plate on. Now on to my main course, I opted for one of the specials of the night, a bone in prime with new Mexican Chile sauce and a cheese graded over it. Plus a sweet potatoes puree, twice baked in a poblano pepper along with a roasted vegetable medley that was equally agreeable. In a word "delicious" now on to the sweets and closer of the meal. Our choice was the flourless chocolate cake and a creme brulé, both were fantastic and truly they both were standouts but we combined the two for a couple of spoonfuls and wow. Service was exceptional and the ice tea, yes just iced tea was also fresh brewed and all around I recommend eating here at least once in your life.

Lots of good breakfast places in the greater Phoenix area.  I finally got to Richardson's to try theirs, and I'm sorry I didn't make it sooner.  Now I want to work through their entire brunch menu.  I had the Adovada Benedict.  Outstanding, and something I'd never find back home.  It's not really a trip to the Phoenix area if you don't stop for at least one meal here.

This place never disappoints. I love the food especially as it's on the spicy side. They have a large selection of southwestern style steak & seafood.   I ordered the Taos Tenderloin, which is 3 medallions, each with a different sauce. The meal comes with a salad. The main dish is served on a tortilla with beans and a green chile potato (GCP). The meat was so tender! One of the best places in town for spicy food that's not the usual Mexican style cuisine.

Decided to take my wife to Richardsons  after I went there with friends two weeks ago. Didn`t disappoint. Food and service were excellent again. This is becoming one of my favorite places. I can see why it`s been around for 30 years it`s great.

Food is amazing. Staff is not. Been there two times and they got an order wrong on both visits. The wait staff were rigid and not accommodating to questions asked about the menu. They're not rude or terrible; just make you tilt your head and wonder what's up with the people in this place?
This place is awesome! The atmosphere is nice and the new Mexican food is amazing. I'm a big fan of the tenderloin Benedict. Nom.

We celebrated a family birthday here.    Richardson's staff made it as wonderful as twenty years of memories there could have aspired to.  The New Mexico platter was absolutely the epitome of New Mexican Cuisine.  Our native New Mexican was impressed with the adovada entree.  My chorizo pork chop was simply amazing.  Nothing in New Mexico was on this level of service and flavor.  All said another wonderful visit to Richardson's.

So me and a lady friend stopped here for a night out a month back.   We arrived, there seemed to be no self parking or maybe I'm just not aware of it. Because it was just valet at the front. So i of course had to valet it. Which to me is odd. I'm not a huge fan of a valet service. I'm a big boy, I'll park my own fucking vehicle, FOR FREE. But whatev's.   I tried to bypass that. We entered and found a both near the bar. The food is a mix/hybrid/fusion of mexican-new mexican food.   I forgot what I had at the time. But I remember it being REALLY REALLY good. We also shared a great bottle of red wine that our server recommended to us.   The service was awesome, the food was amazing. A bit pricy, but like i've said before. You get what you pay for.   Definitely a place to check out, a wonderful date environment.
No happy hour on valentines day - really, the sign at the door says happy hour everyday!  The food and service is great, Managment not so much- boo

******* 1 star service/ 4 star food ******  What a nightmare!!! What was supposed to be a birthday meal meal for a friend, quickly turned out to be a sideshow...  When we asked the waitress if the special of the night "green chile pasta" had seafood, she adamantly stated no. When asked what type of pasta it was made with she had no clue. She the proceeded to inch her way over to the next table of diners and poke them for the answer. After much debate the patrons determined it was a rice noodle. This was very uncomfortable for all parties.   2 of us received our meals. When Our birthday friend received his pasta special... It was decorated with shrimp. We specifically asked about seafood due to allergies and were told no seafood was included. When we advised our server that we could not accept the meal due to the seafood, she shrugged us off and said she would send over the waitress. Once the waitress arrived we explained the allergy situation again and advised her that this could not be eaten... Instead of apologizing for her error, she asked if we wanted them to "remove" the shrimp??? We stated to her that it would need to be remade. With some resistance she took the plate. 10 minutes later a shrimp free version arrived.  Our birthday guest had to wait 10 more minutes than we did to receive his food. We opted to eat our dishes, otherwise, we would have had cold dishes ourselves....  The total bill for this event was $ 154.00 + tax. I tipped the waitress $40.00 as a courtesy as I was advised she split tips with the busboy and server- who very polite and on point.  I proceeded to email Richardsons to advise of the experience. It has been 2 + weeks and not a word from this restaurant. I was not looking for anything except an apolgy and ownership for ruining a birthday celebration.  This restaurant is far from a 3 star service level... What a shame as the food is exceptional. Recognizing that the entire experience is key when charging $25.00 + price points for meal is a must in this competitive market.  Stick to Barrio Cafe as they have the formula for success down. I will never eat here again and route all co-workers, family and friends elsewhere.

Everything I had was wonderful during two visits.  The Chipotle ribs were to die for - perfect spice and loads of flavor.  The New Mexico spiced sausage were also a wonderful balance of spice and flavor and accompanied with some of the best pinto beans that I have ever had.  Then there was the CARNE ADOVADA which was perfectly cooked and wonderfully flavor filled.  The NEW MEXICO ENCHILADAS were accompanied by Christmas sauce - both red and green.  The green sauce was perfectly spiced unlike most more bland green sauces.  I only regret is that I never had room for dessert.

Came here for lunch at the end of a conference last week with three other conference attendees and enjoyed a wonderful and unique Southwestern style lunch.  I ordered the Carne Adovada with Eggs; a huge plate with 3 eggs (mine over easy - is their any other way?), a huge chunk of smoked pork simmered in red chili, potatoes (or you can have hash browns), beans all served over a tortilla. The eggs were cooked perfectly, the pork was fall apart fork tender smothered in a rich red chili that added great depth of flavor without overpowering the meat. The potatoes were large cut and good. A real delicious meal that went great with the house margarita.  My other friends each ordered something different, and they all looked really good, especially the Relleno Platter, which I was thinking about ordering before I decided on the Carne Adovada. In fact, there were many things on the menu that I would have liked to try - so much to try but only one lunch/day.  I really enjoyed this place and will seek it out again if I'm in the area.

Best Southwestern food in the Valley - Dick's Hideaway was part of Richardson's. They have the very best New Mexico style food especially the Carne Avodada breakfast dish. Service is always good and the atmosphere is great which is essential for fine dining. To bear this out; PF Changs opened a spin off Asian restaurant that was about 5,000 s.f. and almost never filled up. Because of this "cafeteria" atmosphere, even though the food was identical to PF Chang's it didn't taste as good and the experience was not there. Goes to show that PF Chang's and Oregano's have got it down. They have good food and are limited in seating so that they are always full and on a wait which really adds to the atmosphere.

Food was excellent, service was great, first time here and I will definitely be back! Sat at the bar and the gal that took care of us did an excellent job! She left before we were done and the new girl was pretty good too but the first girl was awesome!

This was by far the perfect find for our dinner last night. The atmosphere of the restaurant was dimly lit, romantic and had a touch of prohibition feeling. Valet parking was a plus. We sat at the bar but there were several seating options. The bartender was on point with his drinks and the food was amazing! The Carne Avado was spicy and so flavorful even my husband who does need eat spicy food enjoyed the complex flavors. I had a chicken Caesar with grilled chicken. A single position is enough for two but on the bright side we have our lunch for today. I would ram commend going and may go again during my trip to Phoenix. This restarting would rival anything in Portland, Or.
I liked it, but got my sodium intake for a month

Went to Richardson's for the first time the other day after hearing about the place for a long time.  I thought the food was good but not great.  The atmosphere as nice but a bit dark for my tastes (to each his own).  Overall I guess I was expecting a bit more than this place delivered.  I had the enchilada plate and as i said it was good but did not stand out compared to other new Mexican enchiladas.  I liked the salsa a lot but the chips were pretty oily. I would go again if someone I know wants to go there - but it it is not high up on my list for a repeat visit - -  overall, the food did not overwhelm me and for Mexican/New Mexican the price was a bit high.  Not a hater of of the place but not a lover either.

Bleh. If you're like me and searching for new Mexican style green chili outside of Colorado and New Mexico don't come here. Staff is really friendly and the place is pretty cool but the food tastes nothing like New Mexico style. The green chili smothered is actually just shredded green chili there's no pork or stew so sorry none of that. Bummed.

This was our first visit with some friends who were regulars.  Our friends go ocean fishing at least once a year so when they say that this is a good place to get fresh fish we listen!!  Our group had the halibut ($26) which was outstanding.  It had a pico de gallo salsa that I had on the side in case it was too spicy.  It had a mashed potato side served in a roasted whole green Anaheim pepper.  Excellent!!  The small salads with salmon, either 4 oz or 8 oz depending on the salad size was excellent.  The seafood trilogy was excellent as well.  They have large billboards with the specials of the day.  Our server was attentive without being intrusive.  It appears to be a "mom and pop" place which is our favorite.  They have a good selection of wines that are a little pricey but wine really does enhance the meal.  Our total tab was $125 for four of us with full entree's and a total of 5 wines ordered.

Richardson's brunch always offers great tasting food with a Southwestern Flair. The portions are large, and The Taste is deep. Very good Southwestern flavored food. The service is always well done and the environment Lively.

From out of town and was looking for some authentic southwest food. This placed delivered in their food, ambiance and friendly service. All food items my wife and i had were excellent. Highly recommended even if you have to drive for 30 minutes (unless you plan to over serve yourself).

Atmosphere is a 4- very casual, great date night place. Service is a 4- solid,attentive, and very knowledgeable about the menu  FOOD- is a 4, awesome appetizers, and great fare. My favorite is the pork shoulder (advova) dish, and the enchiladas. I love the queso, elephant garlic, and the rib appetizer.  its awesome, you have to go if you are in town.

Was just there for a company Christmas party and let me tell you, awful service. I never got my salad prior to my dinner, fucking salad never came. Never got a chips refill, service staff was awkward and not interested in working. Had a way different experience last time we were there in a big group. The food quality was also lame. Subpar. Mixed drinks were also on the verge of being pure ice and water. Wont ever ever go there again. Cant believe that a big group received such poor and awful service.

See my review of Dick's Hideaway for more details on this company's self righteous attitude.   So, I was planning a birthday dinner party. If you've ever been to Richardson's patio and sat at the big table outside on a beautiful AZ evening or day, you know why I thought it would be nice to have the party there.   Well, I called 40days ahead of time to try and reserve the space. They will not speak with you about it on the phone and instruct you to email them with your request. So, I did. 25 days later, I'd not heard back from them so I called. I was told to email again. I did. Then 10days before my event,  I emailed again stating that I was very dissappointed that they hadn't replied and that I guess I'll find another venue. So I did. After all, if you're expecting to get a party of 15 at a nice table on a Saturday night during high season, you'd better plan ahead!   Literally, LITERALLY, the day before on Friday afternoon, they called me to see if I still wanted the table. LOL! Really!!?? As if I would have thought for one minute that that would come through and I'd be able to tell 15 guests on Friday night, where to be on Saturday night!   Clueless. Entitled. They have lost ALL perspective.

No matter what the knuckleheads say this is one of the finest restaurants in the greater PHX area.  There is NEVER poor service.  The service when it busy slows down is normal, but not excessive.  The drinks are awesome.  The food is always excellent.  They have spicey and nonspicey food.  Prices run from $15 to $40 and yet it is not cheap, but not expensive because u get quality and a great experience.  Just try it@!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This is one of my favorite restaurants to visit when I'm craving some good and fresh tasting New Mexican specialties. The flavors are out of this world and it will make your mouth dance with joy.  Been to their other restaurants many times and always enjoy coming back. First got to experience this kind of treat at their older restaurant that mysteriously caught on fire. This place is a favorite of my boss and he usually pays. Nice!  Love the Chimayo Chicken and on other visits order one of the Fish Specials written on the board. The appetizers are delicious and you can easily get filled up on them quickly. Really enjoyed the Green Chili French Onion Soup on my last visit. It had the perfect amount of heat for me and made me break a sweat.  Service can be somewhat mediocre at times. Make sure to also bring a flashlight or have your smart phone app ready to go. It is ridiculously dark in there and can create a bit of a problem. You can always choose to eat outside at the bar or at one of the smaller tables.  This is not a cheap and inexpensive dining experience. Then again it is not super duper crazy expensive. They do have valet parking at certain times so don't be surprised.  Give them a shout out and get ready for some yummy flavors. You won't be disappointed. TOUCHDOWN IN MY MOUTH!  4.5 STARS

So this has been my favorite place for years, but last week we had a group of friends meet there. The food did not come up evenly, it felt like the servers were not on the ball. Started with 4 trips to bring silverware to the group, and not enough glasses. I got my meal after everyone else had finished their meals. Told him to just cancel my meal, but he said it was on its way and I ordered it. I thought it would have been dropped off the bill, but it was not even reduced in price. I feel like customer service need retrained. The food tasted great as always, but not enough bread to go with the Garlic plate, they brought more, but meals had been delivered.. I have been taking family and friends to Richardson's over 20 years, but now I will have to rethink my GO-TO place.

My family and I have been coming to Richardsons for over 15 years at least once a month. My Dad recently experienced some health issues and needs a wheel chair. We called to make a reservation for an ADA table and was told they couldn't make the reservation less than four people. Two weeks earlier, we called and got the reservation. The man of the phone was rude, unwilling to help us at all. I even told him of our patronage and previous reservation. He basically hung up on me. We will never go to this establishment ever again. You just lost a 15 year costumer.

The food is great but the margaritas are the bomb.  I had the mole and it was rich and just the right spice.    Our waiter was a hoot, asking a lot of questions and super helpful on ordering.  Even giving us a hard time because we ordered the same thing and we should have ordered different items and share.  It was a good time.  Did I mention how great the margaritas were?

This local restaurant is a gem. This is located down the street from the Hilton at Squaw Peak and probably the best restaurant in the area that is filled with a lot of chain type restaurants. I had heard about the Rokerij small plates menu from office workers and I thought I would give it a try. My girlfriend and I did not have any reservations, so we went downstairs in their bar area and ate the bar. You can order the Mew Mexican specialities or the Rokerij side of the menu. There was so much to choose from so we decided to eat off of the small plates menu. We chose the 3 small plates for $25. I was thinking the plates were going to be small and that we would not be filled. I appreciated that on the menu they told you how many "pieces" you were going to get of each item. The tenderloin on toast with triple cream brie was delicious. The amount of tenderloin was just right and the cream brie made it taste over the top. The scallops were cooked perfectly as well. Thoroughly enjoyed the taco sampler. Everything is fresh and the service was great. The couple next to us ordered off of the New Mexican cuisine side. The servings were ample and looked very tasty. I have heard the menu for brunch is equally fanstastic, can't wait to go back!
Food was just okay.  Waiter was rude and arrogant.  Noise level extremely loud on a Tuesday!  Won't go back.
AH-MAZING!  Absolutely love this place.  Try the turkey enchiladas - so good!

My wife and I are from New Mexico and were thrilled with the find. Richardson is one of our favorite places. Because of the food we had our wedding reception there last Saturday. Everyone raved about the food.... Well, except two young people who thought the food was spicey. Their server was on top of it and got them both something to satisfy their taste buds The wait staff and management were fantastic.   The reason I gave a 4 instead of a 5? Because of the poor follow through/communication. I worked with one  office staff for scheduling. The first impression was great but her follow thruogh was minimal to non existent at times. Finally, after 2 weeks of no communication (3 weeks til the wedding) I complained! To everyone who would listen. I even posted on Yelp. The next day I got a call and a text.  After all is said and done...I am grateful all worked out in the end. Regardless of all the bumpy couple of weeks. Richardson is the bomb and worth your patronage!

After reading reviews on Richardson's, I wasn't sure what to expect. I grew up on New Mexican fare and it is not an easy cuisine to perfect. I was also a little reluctant toward the menu as their vegetarian options seemed few and far between.   We visited the restaurant with another couple who are avid carnivores. We were pleasantly surprised to find something on the menu for everyone. My husband and I split the chili rellenos and cheese enchiladas. The beans are vegetarian but the rice is not so in lieu of it, we were able to get a green chili potato (ridiculously tasty). The food was delightfully packed with heat -- the kind of heat that's cured by a bowl of ice cream or more of what caused the burn in the first place. It IS spicy so be sure to heed the warning on their menu. I dabbed my forehead with a napkin more than once.   To me, there's something about a server who knows her stuff. Our server was fantastic. We wanted for nothing during our entire experience and she knew exactly what was safe for us to eat as vegetarians.   I don't agree with others who think this place is overpriced. Our party of four had the same number of entrees, a bottle of wine, and two cocktails for $120. And yes, they only have valet parking. Welcome to any good restaurant in Phoenix. Can't wait to visit again and get my sweat on!

Richardson's is an excellent choice if you love high quality New Mexican food. Today we enjoyed a delicious brunch- enchiladas (cheese & beef) Christmas style (red&green chile), carne adovada & over easy eggs, a bowl of beans with red chile, onions & cheese, mimosas, and bloody Mary's.   All were excellent!!!  It was a beautiful day so the patio seating was full but we were able to grab a spot at the bar inside which is always a good place to sit and enjoy your meal and cocktails. Next-door, at the Rokerij, or just south on the opposite side of 16 th street, at Dick's Hideaway, sitting at the bar is definitely The way to go because you can watch as the cooks prepare your food and enjoy the wonderful smell of the pecan wood used in the grills.  Both the red and green chile are excellent- I generally prefer the red, but only slightly.  There's not a bad thing on the menu and they always have some great specials that are not on the menu- The only challenge is convincing myself to order something other than my favorites that are on the menu!
Today (9/2), they fulfilled their promise... Richardson's.  It has taken over a month but they came through.  Sorry to have had to hound them but I guess ok.

Just tremendous service, great food and a really nice atmosphere. We brought our kids and although there weren't any other kids there we all had a great time and loved the food. The pizzas are great, but they are better knows for their enchiladas and quesadillas - and for good reason. The portions are huge and they taste fantastic. Would highly recommend for a fun night out.

Went for my 40th birthday at the large patio table. It was a great choice. The ambiance was amazing, the food was so good. Our server Tana was a 5 also she was engaging and we had great conversation with her. It was like she was a part if our table and party. After dinner we visited the basement bar and found it to be so cozy and inviting. This is an excellent restaurant and I will be back!
Great food.  The red and green chillie sauces had a good amount of "heat".  Will definitely go back my next trip to Phoenix
Had the pan seared salmon it was so unbelievably great perfectly seared on each side pink in the middle with the capers in the sauce Homerun.

After hearing about this place for years, I finally decided to give it a try. My husband and I came here for Sunday brunch. We were seated promptly and served chips and salsa right away. I ordered a $5 bellini which was on special and decided on the tenderloin hash special and my husband ordered the crab cake benedict. My tenderloin hash was cooked to my specifications along with a nice runny fried egg on top with beans on the side. My bellini was a generous pour as well. My husbands benedict was amazing and full of flavor with a rich hollondaise and really good crab cakes , I was jealous I didn't order it. The portion sizes were huge, we probably could've shared one dish. Prices were a little on the higher side, but the quality and amount of food made up for it.
Best New Mexican restaurant in Phoenix. It's a 30 minute drive from the east valley, but worth it for the great food, good service, and ambiance. The free valet parking is a nice touch.

I have eaten at Richardson's many times and have always loved it, but this past weekend has made me rethink whether I will ever return.  Out of town company were very excited to dine there as I had raved about it.  Well, the waitress, Diane, made our evening miserable.  We sat for quite some time waiting for her to come.  We had questions about the menu, specials in particular, and she sulked off to bring us a chalk board as we couldn't see all of the ones on the walls.  She then left the table and didn't come back for a long time.  Once she did, she  stood at the tableside, chewing gum and jutting out one hip.  We were clearly boring her.  Questions asked of her were not audible in their response.  Never have is felt so embarrassed as my out of town company were very shocked and very disappointed.  Perhaps I could expect this treatment at Hooter's, but the total indifference was very very difficult.  If you get Diane, you might consider moving to another table and if she is chewing gum, it might be the same piece as she chomped on it the entire evening.  Very sad, indeed.

I like the place... Very quiet. The staff is attentive. Other patrons are pleasant. Great menu... Something to please even the pickiest of eaters.  Totally not a fan of the ceviche. They do not cook the fish in lime juice...so I was told by a staff member. The shrimp delivered on a bed of rice was delicious tho!

if you love new mexico hatch green chilis or just want a really delicious breakfast with quality ingredients, this is the place to go...the food is superb and worth every penny...and the atmosphere of the restaurant is awesome if you are someone like me who misses living in new mexico!!!    loretta in phx.

Extremely disappointed in Richardson's and the Rokery. We stopped in today for lunch and asked for a table. There were at least 4 open tables, the larger tables, but still they were open. The bartender and then the hostess were only willing to seat us at the bar since we were a party of two. We were looking for a sit down lunch in which we planned to eat and enjoy several drinks.  We walked out after realizing the staff had no desire to accommodate us or concern for losing a customer. We decided to go down to the Rokery to see if the attitude was different there. It was complete empty yet all the tables said reserved.  We asked the bartender if we could sit at a table. He had to excuse himself to go upstairs to ask permission. That was enough for us. There are too many good places to eat in Phoenix.  Oh by the way, until today we were loyal regulars to all three Richardson's restaurants.

Our group of four had dinner at Richardson's tonight and we are still waiting to have feeling return in our mouths. The guacamole was hot and this was before we added salsa, and our dinners consisting of enchiladas and chicken rellenos were inedible. The chiles overwhelmed all taste. We heard people at an adjacent table complaining about the over-spiced food, too. We think the chef may have gotten carried away with chiles.  That was all so disappointing since we had friends from out-of-town who we had told they were in for something special. We were right but also so wrong.

Richardson's is a true classic in the Valley! It has been here forever! I have been dining here since I was a young girl (...it is one of my dad's favorites) and have ALWAYS loved their delicious house salad! Last night, I told my boyfriend that I hadn't been in years and wanted to check it out again on our date night! Not much has changed, it is still the same dark and cozy atmosphere! And yup, the salad was just as delicious! This time I ordered it with beef tenderloin and the meat was marinated and cooked to perfection! We also split the queso dip with chorizo as an appetizer and it was fantastic. The house margarita was not the best marg that i've ever had but it did the trick. You should also know that it IS a little pricey. I was actually pretty shocked by some of the entree prices but if you stick with the basic meals (enchiladas, burgers, etc.), you can order a plate under $25. I'm sure we'll be back with family again soon!

My husband, having lived in Phoenix for 40 years, has been a huge Richardson's fan. After the fire, we were both waiting for news of its reopening.  While driving  south on 16th street, I darn near gave myself whiplash when I saw a lovely building that said "Richardson's".  I texted my husband and 3 hours later, we walked in for dinner. The place was packed,and I had no idea what "Rokery" was.....Richardson's sister restaurant next door. This is where it gets confusing. While we were checking out the drop-dead gorgeous candlelit entry-patio, we were led to a table at Rokery .....not understanding why, not understanding the two-sided menu, etc. On the plus side, the booths are huge,  but I am not a fan of the open-kitchen concept because of the noise. Our booth was 8 feet from the bar and kitchen and conversing was impossible, and we there for a special occasion. It turns out that they serve both menus in either restaurant, with Rokery having an impressive fish-steak menu - which we will definitely return for. The daily specials - posted on a blackboard/wall was a small novel of offerings. We started with the Pomagranet margarita, which was very weak on the tequila. We ordered two of the Mexican entrees, which were very authentic and spicy. The only problem with my husband's plate was that it had been placed under a broiler and  the red chili sauce  had coagulated into a blackened, burnt- tasting flavor. Surprisingly, he didn't finish half of it......very unusual. My selection of the Mexican Platter was excellent, but could be delivered to the table at a temperature that is less than molten lava. It must have taken 15 minutes before it cooled enough to eat it. At any rate, the new location is beautiful, although when they welcome you, they need to tour and explain the two neighboring restaurants and the fact that you can order from both sides of the menu. I would love to give them the additional  stars the next time we visit.

The breakfast combo is the best brunch meal I've ever had. My only mistake was ordering it Christmas because the green sauce is amazing! The only thing I might change is the meat choice for the benedict.

I searched yelp and found that this place had pretty good reviews for New Mexico style food (note it's not "standard" Mexican food or Tex Mex)  I don't get any NM food in California so when I visited Phoenix yesterday and today, I jumped at the chance to get even a temporary fill.   I had the huevos rancheros (Christmas style- Red and green chili) with potatoes and beans and a tortilla.   The portions were big and I left content! The food was tasty and is making me miss New Mexico even more. The service was excellent. The place has a cool decor too.  If I'm back in PHX, I'll definitely stop here!  By the way, they said the name of the restaurant isn't related to the family of Bill Richardson... Former NM governor.

Stopped in once again after a short hiatus and found the service to still be less than adequate. One feels like they're a bother asking for someone to take an order or get a refill because they're just so busy with preparations and waiting on tables. I don't believe it is the help's fault ...they all appear to do their best. But there is a genuine lack of any small talk or anyone asking you "how did you enjoy your meal?, etc." I believe it must be the management that schedules too few employees. At any rate, the food still rocks and the pours are generous. Happy hour prices are competitive with an array of excellent menu choices. Pork & dirty rice, the chili rellenos w/ red or green sauce is amazing, but very spicy at times (especially if you order the red sauce). Their chicken, shrimp and beef skewers are amazing. Basically, you can't go wrong here.

Went to dinner tonight at Richardsons. I felt nickled and dimed from the moment I arrived. Forced valet or park a block away. We requested bread with our spicy soup and were brought 2 tortillas that we were charged $2 bucks for. And the food although different wasn't worth $75 dollars for 2 people with no alcohol. I have no problem spending $300 for an amazing dinner but this food and restaurant was not worth the cost. Skip it and go to Abuleos. Just as good or better and a much better value.
Loved this restaurant!!! Food was excellent! They have a nice outdoor patio. Would come back if im ever in town again. The Adovada benedict was soooooo good.
The food is unbelievable!  I love the smallness and ambience.  It strays away from the chain aura every other restaurant has.  The quesadilla dip is one-of-a-kind.

We have been to Richardson's many times over the years and have always found the food to be consistent- steaks, seafood, fish, specials- have all been excellent. But we had a problem on our last visit that really affected our experience- The service was poor-our waiter recited the specials in such a low voice that half of our party couldn't hear him, and our drinks took 15-20 minutes to arrive and came out 1or 2 at a time for a party of 6. The bar appeared to be well staffed so not sure what the issue was, but it was disappointing  to have such lackluster service at one of our favorite places.

Every year I come to town I eat here. And every year I love it. The service from curb to bar to table is great. No valet to night so we parked in back no big deal. The margaritas were made perfect. We had several dishes in my group and all of them were made hit and tasty. I think you can not go wrong here and the bill was reasonable for a group of 6. Try this place you won't regret it. I would be patient if your on a time crunch it stays very busy.

Upon walking into Richardson's, I instantly fell in love with its unique environment. A very fun and cute restaurant that perfectly paralleled Arizona's desert culture.   We stopped in around 9:30PM for dinner and found out that there was happy hour until close. I decided to indulge in the vast list of sliders. I opted for the steak and brie while my friend the salmon. Both versions were absolutely delicious. The steak and brie was a bit on the pricier side, at around $18, and the salmon was around the $12-15 range. The sliders were hefty, and although both plates left us full, I found the salmon to be slightly more bang for your buck, especially being that they were filled with huge chunks of salmon.   Overall a solid restaurant to enjoy food with friends and family. Would definitely stop in again if I ever found myself in the North Phoenix area!

Being a true New Mexican I had to try this place out. When you pull into the parking lot it's valet only, I'm not a fan of that at all but it's complimentary and being the lots so small it's understandable. When you walk in you enter into the patio dining with lots of tables and room. The restaurant inside is extremely small and when I went it was packed, I recommend a reservation on weekends. I had to sit on the patio and it was a bit chilly. I ordered the Carne Adovado. It came with pinto beans and rice. The red chile was delicious, it was truly New Mexican no doubt. The pork was smoked which isn't in any way, shape or form New Mexican but it was extremely tender. I wasn't a fan of the smokey flavor with the red chile. True New Mexican restaurants serves chips and salsa before the meal and sopapillas with the meal. I missed that but all in all I would go back for the red chile alone.

Great atmosphere. We had a corner booth. Not too crowded for a Thursday night. Low lighting. Large portions, so maybe order to share. We started w the cheese dip which was yummy. I had the tortilla crusted fish with broccolini and the famous potato. While the potato was just okay, the rest of the meal was delicious. Free valet parking. I'd visit again.

Dark cozy spot with a great menu and nice selection of cocktails, wines and beer.  Food was solid , with  our group ordering a nice selection of small plates, including scallops, and beef skewers, served with a tasty selection of salsas.   Our server seated us immediately, walked us thru the menu and then disappeared .  Subsequent service was slow, with orders arriving at different times and one not at all.  Good if you have time and are in the neighborhood.

We were referred by the Sheraton Grand hotel.  The front of the house staff were friendly and informative. The Pueblo style and warm ambience were inviting.  The layers of flavors were quite remarkable.  Overall an Outstanding experience. We will be back.

This is a hard review to write.  I really want to give the restaurant 1 star for the very poor service.  However, the food is good, I felt obliged to give it 3 stars.  Service - called last week to make a reservation for 3 for 6pm Sat night.   Was told they don't take reservations for parties of 3.  Show up to the restaurant at 5:30pm. Hostess says we can sit at the bar and she'll put or name on the wait list.  Meanwhile, at the bar we watch several parties of 2, without reservations, get seated at tables large enough for 4.  Hour and a half later...still no table for 3. Hhhmmmm...  Food - carne sliders were too sweet and the ratio of meat to bread was off.  Relleno was outstanding!!! Bacon wrapped shrimp incredible, Queso was just ok.  Not sure what the restaurant has against parties of 3, but FYI, parties of 3 tend to spend more than parties of 2.

I have been to Richardson's many times and it still remains one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix.  For the people complaining about the food being spicy, um, it is a restaurant serving New Mexico cuisine - it is supposed to be spicy.  My favorite dish has to be the Relleno Platter.  I usually split it with a friend because the portion is huge: two rellenos with rice and beans.  I especially like the pork rellenos with verde sauce, but there's also smoked turkey, beef and regular cheese.  Their margaritas are outstanding...honestly, I haven't had anything that was bad at this restaurant.  And the wait staff is friendly, too.    I love their patio renovation.  It is stylish and sophisticated with a modern New Mexico ambiance.  Great for having dinner and/or drinks outdoors on one of our beautiful Phoenix evenings.

We sat at the bar since it was an early dinner. We ordered off the happy hour menu - pork sliders, queso and chips and ribs.  The sliders turned out to be the worst of the bunch.  The pulled pork was a bit dry and though the bun was nice, the whole thing was bland without some kind of sauce maybe.  The queso was probably one of the best I've ever had.  The ribs fell off the bone and the seasoning was pretty tasty despite the appearance of the dish.  The wine I had was very good, the margarita my friend had was super tangy but he enjoyed it.  All in all, I'd like to explore the menu further and maybe venture to the basement.  :)
Awesome food, atmosphere, and drinks.  We ate in the downstairs bar and loved it.  I had the New Mexican Platter.  You should try it soon.

I'm a long time fan of Richardson's and after finally visiting the new location I am head over heels again! I love that the new place looks just like the old place inside, except a bit bigger it seems. I love the food and the specials are amazing. I recently tried a green chile tilapia that was incredible! I have family in town soon and already know we are going to Richardson's for a meal.

We finally visited the new restaurant 3 1/2 years after the Richardson's fire. It is quite amazing how similar the new Richardson's looks and feels like the former landmark restaurant. Their service is great. We ordered a pizza and salad. I should have known better to order a pizza from a New Mexico style restaurant... roasted tomato sauce with New Mexico sausage and mozzarella. It brought back memories of conversations with my Papa debating whether Prego or Ragu was the better canned tomato sauce.

Wow...do I ever love this place!  We stopped in Saturday for happy hour and dinner and it reminded us how much we missed this place.  Love that they offer $6 glasses of wine for happy hour at the tables as well as the bar - I enjoyed a lovely Silverado Sauvignon Blanc.  We shared the spinach queso, green chile pork tamale, chicken, beef, shrimp and sausage skewers over rice and pinto beans and the shrimp and scallop pasta with a side salad.  We definitely overdid it, but couldn't decide what NOT to have...tough problem, right?  After dinner we went to the cellar bar at the Rokerij...perfect way to end an evening on a hot summer day!

This is one of the few places in Phoenix that is truly unique.  Both the atmosphere and food are something you can't get anywhere else!  There is a back entrance which is really cool, a descending stone stairwell in front that leads to the underground bar, and a main entrance.  They call their food "New Mexican Cuisine" which is perfect.  It's not traditional Mexican, they have little tweeks and variations of many Mexican favorites.  Mixed in are modern American fish and chicken dishes with a new Mexican twist.  You can regularly catch them fire roasting the green chiles out back, and they are used in various dishes.  I love stopping in here anytime I'm in the area.  It is a must try if you like finding something that provides a break from the mass produced and safe, boring menus of the corporate culinary machine.
Best brunch and always a stop for us when we're in Phoenix. Great New Mexico Chile, both red and green, though I prefer red. Jalapeño hollandaise is soooo good.

Having dined here approximately 5 years ago and having enjoyed our meals I wanted to revisit the restaurant.   First, is the mandatory (complementary) valet parking. I am perfectly capable of parking my own car, thank you, without the need to use a valet service.   Second, chips and salsa:  Sorry, Chevy's is just as good but the habanero salsa is wonderfully freakin hot!  Third, my wife's seafood combo was wonderful. My tamales were just so-so with too stringy pork inside. I've had as good or better eating tamales at my farmers market. Rice was dry and crusty in places. The pinto beans were just plain bland.   I'll revisit on my next trip, or maybe not.
Great Pozole and awesome bloody mary's.  We come here often on the weekends and we love this place.
I love Richardson's. Incredible food, great service. One of the best places to eat in Phoenix

Everyone in the "know" in Phoenix knows about the Rokerji / Richardsons. This place serves the best southwestern food hands down. Ask Esquire magazine, who awarded them best bar in America. And of course Phoenix Mag gives their nod to this place almost every year. These 2 restaurants occupy the same real estate but the Rokerji is in the basement and it is my personal favorite. The atmosphere is 5 stars. Big sofas, large booths in a Grotto like setting with a roaring fire. It doesn't get any better than this. The menu is the same whether you choose to stay up top at Richardsons or go down below to the basement. The food is hands down the best of its kind in town. Now if you are heat sensitive, listen to your server. The owner of these places means it when he says "spicy" but it's oh so worth the pain. My favorite here is the Carne Adovada with an egg on top. It is unforgettable. The egg is the magic touch to me with this dish. They tend to have this more on the breakfast side but don't let that deter you. You can have them add the egg anytime. The richness of the warm yolk melding into this dish sends it over the top. Trust me you will absolutely love it. I give The Rokerji / Richardsons 5 stars in spite of some of the tired burned out staff members. Unfortunately some of the servers here have forgotten the true meaning of being in the service industry.  It is my feeling that the owner, Richardson, needs to remind his staff that there is 3 parts to a great dining experience. The ambiance, the fantastic food and the SERVER.  But for now overlook the occasional subpar server and give this place a try. It will become one of your favorite spots right after your first mouthwatering bite.

I have been going to Richardson's for so many years. I can not believe that I have never reviewed this amazing restaurant! It's like an icon to the valley of the sun! Richardson's brings New Mexico to Arizona. Here you can find traditional New Mexican cuisine but also specialities like fish or great steaks with the spice that gives it southwestern flare and taste. I have never had a meal here that wasn't amazing and the service is always, ALWAYS consistent. I like to arrive early, put my name on the 'list' to wait for a table at Richardson's and have a drink 'down below' in the 'dungeon' of Rokerij.. the 'speak easy' feel of going underneath the main restaurant is always mysterious and fun to me. I love all of the copper top on the bars.. I kind of want that on my bar at home! Maybe I am just a little weird?! Okay. I get that! Down at Rokerij, you can pretty much find the same drinks and wines that you find at Richardson's. They have several sparkling wines and champagnes for me too! If its Fall or Spring, the patio of Richardson's is a great place to hang out and there is a fireplace that gives off a great ambient feeling. Drink specials and small plates on happy hour are a really great find! There are great tequilas, mezcals and that leads to what? Great margaritas! Last weekend, I was here with my daughter, who dub's this her 'very favorite restaurant' for southwestern food, when she is home from school on the east coast. This is her first stop and her last stop before heading back to school, always! The bar always makes her a refreshing Prickly Pear Lemonade that she requests when she is here. It's likely not special to her, but she thinks it is, and thats what matters. We always start with the Guacamole, housemade, of course and served with a trio of salsa and duo colored tortilla chips. We always love the New Mexico Con Queso too.. just the right amount of spice and chorizo and served in a hot skillet. This past weekend, I had the Surf and Turf; a nice sized filet mignon, two nice sized grilled prawns atop that, AND, (as if that is not enough!), Chorizo Enchiladas.. they are served open faced. The housemade beans come on the side. This is a huge meal, as most of the entrees here are! This plate is served on the classic pewter Rokerij/Richardson's plate that comes out HOT and will burn you if you don't mind it! I've had most of the entrees here, and again, I have NEVER been disappointed. My daughter had the New Mexico Enchiladas: three generous enchiladas of your choosing, ( she chose the green chile pork; grilled shrimp and the cheese), with green or red sauce and the green is usually the 'milder' of the two. We were so full we didn't want dessert, but the awesome waiter brought us flan anyway to share.. its almost like a caramel type cheesecake thats super creamy! We have had brunch here and again, nothing is even in the 'mediocre' category.. it falls into the 'amazing and FILLING' category! I highly recommend the Enchiladas and Eggs or the Huevos Rancheros and Eggs.. they will do the eggs any style; poached is my personal preference and they don't bat an eye! Oh! Weekend Brunch Mimosas! I like a Mimosa that is mainly Champagne and little OJ , #bckimberly, I swear I was given almost an entire bottle of champs and a small glass of OJ to add as I wished! The Bloody Mary is also worth the hair of your dog.. or your chinny, chin, chin left over from the night before. The staff here is on point.. Maybe one of the best in all of the valley.. attentive and not rushy. They will talk to you; leave the check when you need it to be left; OR let you linger and hang out and enjoy drinks or those mimosas! The history of this restaurant and all its endured makes it a place we continue to come back to over and over.. and now its the same for our daughter who talks about it while at school in DC. Tip: Richardson's does not take reservations unless there are more than 3 in your dinner party and the weekends and some, MANY week nights get busy! Parking is valet; bring cash to pay and tip! :-) Go to Richardson's hungry and ready for New Mexico spice.. this isn't your 'typical' Mexican food!

I think after tonight, this will be the last time I go to Richardson's. My husband likes the place, but I find it overpriced for the quality of food. However, I thought it would be nice to take him there tonight for his birthday. First, you can't make a reservation unless you have a party of four and as I discovered, there are no tables for two people. So when we got to the restaurant, there were no tables available and the bar was full, so we were offered a side bar area or outside sitting at a coffee table type area. Less than stellar choices for a birthday dinner. Finally, we got a couple seats at the bar. I ordered the Grouper with caper lemon butter sauce. Imagine my surprise when I received my dish and there were no capers. Everytime that I have had a caper sauce it has had capers in it. When I asked about it, they looked at me like I was crazy. Plus, all the sauce was absorbed by the tortilla on the plate. So I basically I paid $27 bucks for a dry Grouper with asparagus. My husband kind of liked his dish, but he was not overwhelmed. Yeah, the last time we will go there.
Love the atmosphere. Staff was great. Food/flavors exceptional! Pricey but a lot of food.

Honestly was not at all impressed. The atmosphere is really nice, but that was where it stopped. Went with a group of six, we all agreed that our food was too spicy to really enjoy. On top of that, it is fairly expensive for what you get. I have a hard time paying $20-$30 for Mexican food.

This was a great place for dinner. Plenty of choices on the menu, from salads to pizzas to pastas to classic Mexican-style plates. I went with something called Chimayo chicken, which had sun-dried tomatoes, poblano, spinach, and asiago, along with some delicious veggies on the side, and a green chile potato, which was awesome.  There were quite a few things on the menu that looked good, so I'm sure I'll be back.  Oh, and I almost forgot - I ordered the sopapillas for dessert - best sopapillas I've ever had. Cooked perfectly, just the right amount of crispiness, drizzled with sweet honey. This would be enough of a reason to come back.

We returned here to celebrate my father in laws birthday. Service was great, we were there about 3 pm. Food was excellent. Carne Adovada was superb. Others had the Halibut and meatloaf and that was great also. We had a party of 8 and had a booth, room was adequate. Not a place for large parties unless you sit outside in the misters...

Richardsons is one of my favorite places to eat! They serve New Mexican style food with a luxury twist which is exactly what I was searching for for the last 10 years in Phoenix. It is a bit pricy but in my opinion worth the cost! You have to get the New Mexico enchiladas plate! You will thank me!

Life changing, absolutely!  Finally made it out to Richardson's after hearing nothing but good things about this restaurant. Right as we walked up you could smell the amazingness, is that a word??? Who cares... because the aroma had nothing on the the way the food danced off my tongue. Such a cute dim room, perfect for a date night, and I have to say that I was very impressed the the music selection. I mean who doesn't want to hear great tunes while enjoying a meal. Anyway let's get down to the meal.  We ordered the New Mex con Queso, delicious! Great flavor not too spicy, fresh green chilies and spinach topped with Schreiner's Chorizo. The waiter asked if we had been there before and continued to tell us about their "Signature Dishes". I was already looking at the Pork Chop Chorizo when he sold me on the dish. For $27 you get a pretty decent size salad, fresh and crisp with jalopeno ranch. A side of Richardson's Famous Green Chili Potato, some mixed veggies and the glorious 14oz Pork Chop, double stacked stuffed with chorizo. This sits on top a large tortilla with beans, now you don't want to discard the base, you want it to soak up all the juices from the meat. I made sure to eat each bite of the chop with the beans and tortilla. Holy cow, was it marvelous. It arrives to the table in all it's glory on a silver platter, literally... my mouth dropped. I was not expecting anything of that size, and let me tell you about the icing on the cake or the chop for that matter...Mango Chutney. That definitely gave it the over the top, out of this world, better tan sex flavor...OMG heavenly!  Now, I do consider myself somewhat of foodie for sure...but I have to say, I have not had anything that amazing in a long time. I was expecting to have some great grub but I did not think I was going to come home still salivating over my dinner. Thank god I have more then half left over for lunch. This is for sure my new favorite place, can't wait to come back again. All in all the atmosphere, great wait staff, and quality of food, I give this gem 2 thumbs up! Richardson's I will see you soon.

If you visit, order the New Mexican dishes because that's what they do best. The Enchiladas with Red and Green Sauce (Christmas) and the pork-stuffed Poblano Pepper were fantastic (both traditional New Mexican dishes).  They offer a lot of different types of fish, but the preparation seems a bit of stretch to make it New Mexican. For example, I ordered the Sea Bass with an Orange Chili Glaze. In theory, this sounds delicious, but it was overly sweet with no chili heat for balance. This is a great date spot because many of the tables  and booths are in little nooks for privacy. The sweet potato filled chili is supposed to be what they are known for but for me, it was a bit meh and obviously made en masse before service (which is fine, but make sure it is hot when it is added to the plate). Great cocktails, especially the margaritas.
Brunch today with hubby and best friends--good food, glad I don't have to fly to ABQ just to get adovada,

Very disappointed in the experience from the mixed up, they booked the wrong restaurant, reservation to the meal delivery, every 5 minutes they brought one plate, to the manager that was clearly not interested in discussing my concerns when I asked and they daid he would be right over. Had he done so I would have possibly returned in the future. Their loss not ours. 10 customers lost.

We went there last Sun for brunch.  I'm impressed with the atmosphere most. Love their unique fun kind of foods.  I didn't remember what we ordered but there were  shrimp sandwich, grilled spicy pork, and crab omelet. It won't take long to get the food here and they all are delicious! Worth stopping by :)
The food was just a normal food but it was so expensive. Services was not good. It took alot to take our orders. I did not like the place.

I came here again with a previous co-worker for lunch.  We were able to sit outside on a beautiful cool Thursday afternoon.  The service was great and the place was very clean.  We ordered the following: Chips and Salsa ($3): it came with 3 different salsas. Pico De Gallo, Tomatillo, and Habanero (it was mild though).  It was very good.  The blue and yellow corn chips were warm, light and crispy.  The salsas were great but I wished the Habanero had a stronger kick.    Blue Wedge Salad with Cajun Chicken ($9): The chicken was great, it was moist, tender and very flavorful.  However it had tortilla strips and black bean salsa, so it should have been called the "Tex-Mex Blue Wedge Salad with Chicken". It didn't come with Blue Cheese Crumbles only blue cheese dressing with very little blue cheese crumbles.  Cuban Sandwich ($9): last time I had a Cuban sandwich was at Porto's in Burbank, CA.  Porto's Cuban sandwich had very thinly sliced ham, pork, Swiss cheese in a delicious flatten sandwich.  However, the Cuban Sandwich had 1/2 inch thick ham, roast pork and a green sauce and a Swiss cheese (see picture). They should have renamed this the "Thick Cut Cuban Sandwich".   My visit was good, but I will definitely try another restaurant when I'm in Phoenix, AZ again.
C.J is a server to request . I have never seen someone work so hard . I have been going to Rich/Rok for years and he has made a huge impression. The food was amazing and the service was even bette .

I really enjoyed the food I had here. I had the daily special - a fish trio, with different sauces and preparations. When I left, I was sad that I didn't live in Phoenix. I was also sad that I was with a bunch of my co-workers who, when they were complaining that the food was too spicy, would have looked at me funny for stealing the remainder of THEIR dinners.   This place is an absolute winner.

We stumbled across thid place looking for a mexican place.... this is New Mexican! Carne adovada is as good as everyone is bragging about. Just the right amount of spicy and full of flavor. The pasta dish with shrimp was also a hit. Nice decor and ambiance. Very pleased with the service as well!

Went here with my husband and a friend for dinner. The ambiance is dark but nice. Our friend is from New Mexico and she said they do a very good job making authentic NM food; to me it was a little too salty. Perhaps that is the style of cooking there? The portion sizes are large so that does help to justify the high prices, however, I think in the Phoenix area there are more affordable places to try with food just as good or better.  With that being said, I've only been here once and maybe the chef was just a little too "happy" with the salt that night... I'd try it again if I was in the area. For now, just 3/5.
The food is good and there's a lot of it. The atmosphere is great, but is a little dark.

I hear this is the most authentic New Mexico food in town.   In any event it is really really good. Food is fantastic and the clientele are loyal because you will see the same faces. Excellent place especially over the long haul.

Honestly hands down my favorites brunch spot in PHX. Every time I come I pick a new  menu item and end up ranting and raving about it. I've tried the jalepeño Benedict, the Richardsons Combo, then now the chille rellleno breakfast (pork and beef) . The $5 mimosa or bloody marry are always a winning choice. I can't wait to come for lunch or dinner! This place knows what they are doing.

Took friends here for lunch ... It had been a while since my last visit and wanted to try it again.  So glad I did!  I ordered the New Mexican Platter ... Everything was perfect as I expected.  The right amount of heat, spice, and temperature.  Too often foods are over or under spiced, or too salty, too cool.  I love it when they get it spot on.  Dining companions had the relleno platter and the Santa Fe chicken.  Everyone was pleased with their meals.    I did order the GCP (Green Chile Potato) .. It was good, but didn't blow my socks off as I had expected.  Don't get me wrong - I just won't order it as an additional side item.    Overall - kudos on a great meal and great service!

All I hear about from Richardson's employees is what a dick Richardson is, and how they all hate working for him. I have to say, it shows. The service was horrendous, the brunch doesn't accomodate families. The menu is full of empty threats regarding plate sharing and a 20% gratuity on parties of 8 or more. The food looks tremendous, but I couldn't bring myself to order because my beer came to the table looking like someone had taken a swig from it, and we were waiting 15 minutes for a cup of coffee. The only people this place serves with respect and decency during Sunday morning brunch are martini ordering geriatrics and drunks from the night before. It has a great reputation, yet feels the need to ride the coattails of that as opposed to holding a quality/standard of service that should be commonplace in an area with strict competition. Do not bring your children. this place obviously prefers to serve adult clientele. My daughter is three, well behaved but we were still ignored.

I issued a challenge to my ex-pro baseball player buddy: Find me the best spot in the area for Southwestern cuisine. NOT Tex-Mex, but true Southwestern. Oh, and it needs to be a "spot I've not tried". He knows I camp out at The Mission and absolutely love the food, so getting close was a challenge.   Richardson's Cusine of New Mexico is a unique dining spot with an "Old Phoenix" ambiance. It helps that it's also located in "Old Phoenix" and is dark and cozy. I had a special called the Taos Trio or combo. It consisted of Carne Adovado, Bacon wrapped Shrimp and home made spicy sausage with green chili potatoes. Incredible food! Several people ordered the Chilean seabass which I tried and this was also wonderful.  Service was excellent and we really enjoyed dining for 4. Apparently, this place takes no reservations, but uses a call-ahead approach up to about 6:45. We were in Paradise Valley and gave the 10 minute warning and they greeted us as we came in.  Excellent food and really nice people!

As a long time patron of Richardson's I am always taking new people in and encouraging others to come downtown and try it!  This occasion, February 28, 2014, one of my good friends and I stopped in for a much anticipated lunch together.  This is the first time I have ever considered never returning.  The restaurant was not busy  There was only 12 people in the inside dining area between 11 am and 12:30. We arrived at 11am and chose to sit at the bar inside. The young woman at the bar greeted me and served me a glass of wine and then proceeded to continue her "set up the bar" duties.   When my friend arrived we waited several minutes and then I had to call to the server to ask someone to take my friend's drink order. 5 + minutes later our server/bartender still had not brought the requested beer although the server/bartender was right there on the other side of the bar in full view. 3 feet away from us. Remember the restaurant was not busy.  We ordeedr the bacon-wrapped shrimp appetizer to share and it arrived in a reasonable amount of time and was amazing, as usual.  Unfortunately we could not seem to get ANY service for a glass of water or a second glass of wine.  Again I had to ask the server to please ask the bartender, or whomever was supposed to be working behind the bar, to please see if someone was available to serve us. At this point we still had not been able to order lunch.  The Bartender/ young woman who initially served us come up to take the drink order and I asked if the three salads on the chalk board were good.  She assured me they were excellent.  I am used to the house salad, which is excellent, and we assumed we could count on something of that quality.   We ordered the beef tenderloin salad split and another glass of wine and a beer. 12-15 minutes later we still did not have our drinks. There was NO ONE new inside the dining room and one party out on the patio and several servers so as far as we could see there was no reason for the total lack of service.  Another 10-15 minutes and the salad showed up on one plate.   This salad was a very un-inspired 'Cesar" with limp flavourless beef flopped on top of a mound of rusty romaine lettuce and some basic croutons with some shaved Parmesan Crude and messy presentation and it was certainly not what we envisioned.  The server went to "find" some small plates and the salad was then deposited on the bar for us to split. No serving pieces were provided for us to accomplish this. She also did not offer to assist or to take the salad back to the kitchen to be re-plated.   Maybe I am being picky here but I can get a terrible salad at any Denny's or Village Inn. Richardson's is known for service and quality. The service was non-existent. The salad was terrible, overpriced and tasted flavourless. The only thing that was good was the wine (which we had to practically beg for) and the shrimp appetizer which is all on the kitchen's skill.  So feeling very un-welcome and very disappointed in the salad, lack of service, and our expectations for a great lunch - we gave up and decided to forgo anything additional. 60 dollars later we were happy to just leave.   I am terribly disappointed. Richardson's is my go-to restaurant for special occasions, lunch with friends, happy hour - you name it. I can go to Postino's (closer to my house) or Windsor, Zinburger - any number of other options for a great meal. I fully expect Richardson's uniquely prepared high-end food when I come here and for 60 dollars for lunch I would hope to be at least not frustrated and hungry when I leave.

Their carne adovada, prickly pear margaritas, and patio are what dreams are are of. We always enjoy having a girls night or date night here, especially during cool weather, so we can sit on the patio. It is pricey, but I've never had better carne adovada anywhere!

Their brunch is positively out of this world! And not nearly as expensive as I would have expected - definitely competitive with other brunch places in town. Hands down the best french toast I have ever had in my life - and I'm a snob when it comes to french toast!!

Truly outstanding food!! I had the steak with crab! Wow. The shrimp appetizer was excellent as was the roasted garlic plate!! Service generally good. If the food weren't this great, I wouldn't give 5. I will say the average of 3.5 is definitely way low

Pretty good new Mexican cuisine. Their portion size is hefty and the patio is a must-experience. On the flip side, food can be a bit pricey and they didn't have the desserts they listed. Recommend adovada
We have been in Phoenix for 23 years. We moved here from Tucson and haven't found a great Mexican restaurant until now.   Food is fresh and beautiful  Tana was a very attentive waitress. She is great

I love New Mexican and southwest food. Richardsons took me back to downtown Santa Fe. The atmosphere is perfect - adobe booths and tables. The salsas served were spicy, and yummy!  I had the New Mexican enchiladas with chicken, veggie, and shrimp. I had to try both sauces, so Christmas it was!  This food is authentic, and we enjoyed every bite. The service was superb as well!  A must while in Phoenix!!

Richardson's is New Mexican Cuisine and is similar to Mexican and Tex Mex but is slightly different. The Big Things here are the Potato stuffed green chile and the do you want Red or Green Chile Sauce question.  I tried the Santa Fe Chicken. It came out on a very large ornate silver platter. I have to say everything on my plate was delicious! The chicken was pecan grilled and was very moist and flavorful. It was topped with sautéed mushrooms and Jalapeño hollandaise sauce and served over tasty garlic toast. It was delicious as it was but I though it was shy with the jalapeño. I had my choice of side and went with the house specialty Potato stuffed Green Chile. It had some heat to it but not too much and was delicious. Also on my plate was a very large salad that was mostly cheese. For me it was WHEY too much cheese but the salad was fresh and lightly dressed with a very thin white dressing.  My husband tried the New Mexican Enchiladas. He had a trio of pork, chicken and beef Christmas Style with Red and Green Chile Sauce also filling the plate was rice and beans. He said everything was seasoned nice and everything tasted different and his plate was also very generous with LOTS OF CHEESE.  Based on this one exsperience the food seems solid but you'll need to cheddar a few pounds if you eat all the cheese.  You Cheddar believe it.

Every time I walk in here, I think... I should eat here more often. Every time I walk out I'm reminded why I don't.   A Mexican restaurant is first judged by their salsa. Theirs stinks. Not the first time I tried it either. I can't believe there is a manager or owner that wants to serve this stuff.    I'm sure there are some solid things on the menu, but I'm continually underwhelmed.   5 star atmosphere. 2 star food.  This place could be famous...their food keeps them from it. Pride is needed from someone.
The food is excellent. We have been coming here for years and have never had a bad meal. The seafood is great!

This is probably not the best Mexican food in Phoenix but it's also not the worst. However, it might be one of the most overpriced for an enchilada. However, the ambiance kind of makes up for it, I guess. Subpar but edible if you're looking for a quiet low-key spot. Just bring you wallet and cash for valet. Don't ask very unnecessary.

I love this place and in return they love my money! It is a little on the high end folk's but worth every dime, everytime! The fish is wonderful. Actually, now thinking about it I must have eaten here 5-6 times and have only ordered the fish. This time I enjoyed the sampler with 3 different types of fish prepared 3 different ways. The mashed potato stuffed pepper is a must as well. Suggest dining inside though. The patio is great for a drink while waiting for a table. We decided to eat outside and unfortunately had to quickly retreat inside plates in hand due to the flies.
Great food, beautiful atmosphere.  Must have the sopapillas, they are the best in the area.  Worth the drive from other parts of the valley.

My husband and I go here almost every date night. So... The service isn't exceptional and it's almost always busy but you can't beat the vibe. It's cozy and unique. The food is good. It's a matter of personal preference and we do love it, our friends love it (especially when we're down in the basement sitting by the fire enjoying a bottle of wine and socializing). The Rokerij and Richardsons (same owners, sit side by side) are worth visiting. Oh, and another unique spot that's owned by the same is Dick's Hideaway... My husband loves this place.

Unfortunately, I had a sad, sad experience at Richardson's a few weeks back. I was tasked with planning a dinner for about 50 of my colleagues who would be traveling to AZ from various parts of the country. Because we have been having the most incredible weather and because Richardson's is known for authentic New Mexican cuisine (which I thought many would not have experienced before) I decided on this restaurant's patio for our setting.   Working with the events manager was great, she was very responsive and easy to work with, I had great expectations! Sadly, it all went to sh*t on the night of the dinner. First of all, they had two servers on a 50+ person party. Whaaa? I felt bad for the servers as they were completely set up to fail. Second, when one of my colleagues asked if some of our tables could get water, after waiting 45 minutes, the manager got in her face. Inappropriate!   The manager later apologized and our colleagues who had not yet been greeted or helped were quickly taken care of. I appreciate them stepping up but these thing should have never happened in the first place. As great as the food was, and that is the only reason for my two stars, I will not be heading back to Richardson's anytime soon.
This is high end Mexican food. The ambience is so wonderful as well as the service and food. It is very cozy so great for a date.

We have been to Richardson's many times in the past -- but after moving away and returning recently we decided to go with some local friends last night.  We have not been to Richardson's since the original (which we LOVED) burned down.  We had a 6:45 reservation and could only be seated on the patio -- which was fun, festive, and comfortable.  However, we had to wait a bit for our table so we sat at the bar and ordered up a few drinks.  The bartender was inattentive and aloof -- and the drinks -- margaritas, were horrible!  We were a bit surprised by this.  When we were seated at the table the bartender, again, was our server.  Before we even had a chance to get settled in she came over to take our appetizer order.  We explained that we needed some time because we were just getting settled in, and we still had our bar drinks in front of us.  In less than 5 minutes she was back again -- and quite annoyed that we weren't "ready."    We decided to order appetizers.  When they arrived we were told the plates were HOT and to be careful.  Actually, the plates were barely warm!!  The queso was nearly cold and the skewers were cold as well!  We waited for her to return but she didn't -- so we picked at the appetizer and continued to talk.  When she finally showed up she was ready to take our order but didn't ask about the appetizers, so we told her they were presented cold.  She said, "Hmmm, well you managed to eat most of it!"  How inappropriate was THAT?? And, again, we weren't ready to order because we were busy talking AND we wanted her to get back so we could tell her the appetizers were unacceptable.  Finally, we ordered.  We asked her to please be sure the entrees were warm. Oh, they were warm, alright.  Each of us ordered something different but our plates looked almost identical -- TONS of red chile and everything was dark brown -- burned looking.  My burrito was unrecognizable and so covered in the red sauce as to be unpalatable.  The chile relleno was so-so.   We LOVE spicy food and love spicy chile! This was just unacceptable! Each of us picked at our plates and decided to give it up.  It was horrible! When the server resurfaced and asked if we wanted boxes (because most of our entrees were still on the plate), we told her we didn't.  Again, she didn't even ask if there was a problem!  This visit was not only disappointing, we will NEVER return.  Oh - and the tab for 4 of us was $180.  That would be okay IF the service and food was good!! This server was inattentive, annoying, and not service oriented AT ALL!  She got a 10% tip (and we are typically 20-25% tippers) and left.  We were also quite surprised that a manager didn't come around to check on things.  I can't believe they get repeat customers if that bartender/server is what they have to offer on the patio.  HORRIBLE!!!!!
