Very good...service food and great customer service we arrived at six pm my fiancé birthday wanted to make it special wanted Mexican steaks another application recommend this place very good we did not have reservations  (Saturday night) they made accommodations and made a spontaneous adventure very special my honey had a stuffed pork chop n green chili stuffed with sweet potatoes very good i had their special steak and roasted Brussels sprouts the steak had the best green chili sauce spicy.  Great service by Michelle thank you for making my honeys day that extra special
Such an amazing dinner! Porterhouse and Halibut entrees were amazing. Happy hour menu standouts included chipotle ribs, New Mexican sausages, bacon wrapped shrimp, and stuffed jalapeños.

I like places that are different. This place is like no other. Be prepared to try something you don't normally get. Our table ordered green chili meat loaf, green chili stew, breakfast burrito and a Carne avoda. They were all very tasty.   If you're a foodie and like food experiences, than this I a good one. I'll be back

Amazing food and our server was radical!   She suggested a delicious red wine :  Catena, "Vista Flores", Argentina, Mablec, '12 AND informed us that on certain nights select wine bottles are half off! We felt like winners before even getting our appetizer.  The apps written on the board all sounded grand but we are suckers for the super spicy jalapeño poppers so we stick with them. Both of us loved our entrees and truly I bet I'd be happy eating anything on the menu here. Everything has been so delicious here and at Dicks Hideaway. We favored the ambience here though, and now we have two fabulous places to pick from, depending on our presently desired ambience.  We are coming back soon! Thanks for being so awesome!

I've always wanted to eat at Richardson's and I finally did-  My family of three walked in on a Saturday night (around 5:30) without a reservation and we were sat in a corner booth full of pillows. I loved that it was dark and private with the Red Hot Chili Peppers playing softly over the speakers. The bar was packed and so was the dining room.   When you are an Arizona native you know that salsa is important - three salsa's were served: habanero, spicy pico and a mild (for the kid!). I ordered the blackened scallops with three dipping sauces, rice and beans. 2 thumbs up! My husband ordered the tasty Santa Fe chicken - lot's of flavor! The buttermilk ranch dressing is heavenly if you like that sort of thing.   Nice beer and wine list. They also have top dollar margarita that I plan to partake in after my pregnancy. We will be back! Maybe for breakfast?
Worst excuse for a newMexican restaurant in Phoenix Grizzly meat used during happy hour, very cheap way to service guests, expensive and can do much better going to Scottsdale's frank and Lupe.

Went on a whim based on a friend's recommendation.  This is not "tex mex" but upscale food with Mexican or New Mexican influence.  Prickly pear margarita was excellent, the house salad that came with the entree was good, the jalepano ranch was not at all spicy, but had good flavor.  I had the steak and the portion was huge.  After eating an appetizer (chorizo spinach queso) I couldn't even eat 1/2 my entree. :) the twice baked potato in the green chili was cool and it isn't a sweet potato :) the atmosphere was laid back and decor was cool.  The outdoor space is another restaurant? All in all a good meal and experience.

My favorite place in the neighborhood!  Be chill when you come here.  You can get some food quick but the personality and character of this place is found by taking your time.  The food is amazing and cooked with heart over an open flame.  Get your sauces Christmas.  Always the Duck relleno.  The seabass never disappoints.  Stafg: Rick, Lauren, Robert, Will always be great for you.  Enjoy our neighborhood gem.  To all the no talent asshats posting poor reviews about our local favorite, go to taco $mell.   Its more in line with your writing skills and taste.

Very average new Mexican food. Have been to New Mexico, and while I don't expect a restaurant in Phoenix to match restaurants in Santa Fe, this one unfortunately is not even close. Both red and green chillies which really are the hallmark of new Mexican cuisine are very sub-par. Red chili was a bit bitter and the green chili was just a low on flavor gooey mess. The service was very inattentive as well, too long to take orders or pick up the check. Just remember sitting and waiting for something to happen most of the evening. A lot of mistakes were made as well, the waitress nodded to acknowledge our special requests like "only green chili and not Christmas"  but the dishes eventually came out as they were described on the menu. Don't think we'll be back

Unfortunately, this is my first negative review of a restaurant. New to the Phoenix area, my husband and I went to Richardson's yesterday evening, per our hotel concierge's recommendation.  We ordered drinks, appetizers, and two main courses. I tried the Carne Asada Pizza, and after the first bite, I could barely take another. It was UNBELIEVABLY spicy (the meat was fine, but the pizza sauce was not). It completely ruined the flavor and taste of the pizza - and the over-seasoning of the sauce made it completely inedible. I'm even tolerant towards spicy food and enjoy most meals 'with a kick', but this entree had a BOOT of ruined spicy flavor - and I'm now convinced there was a mistake in the kitchen with over-seasoning/peppering the plate, which I understand can happen on occasion. I tried a few more bites, hoping I had just gotten a flick of habanero pepper, but each subsequent bite was just as bad, TOO hot. My husband could tell I was struggling (ie eyes watering, guzzling water, lips on fire), so I offered a bite to him, to see if my judgement was skewed, and after he tasted, he said 'no, you're right! It's like 'burn a hole in your stomach spicy'!'  And this is when our experience turned for the worse. I've never had to tell a server that I can't eat a plate because it's too spicy, but I respectfully pulled ours aside, and informed her of the situation. I thought she'd be more understanding and would offer to send the dish back and simply have it re-cooked, with less spice. But all she offered me, was a quick, 'I'm sorry.... can I bring you some sour cream?' She explained that the sauce was made like that and never offered to fix the dish (or inform the cook) - but merely asked if I wanted to order something else. After I told her, 'no, I don't need sour cream (which would not have fixed the dish regardless) nor did I want to order (and wait) for another entree,' she took my completely uneaten plate, and the WORST part, brought the check, fully charging us for the pizza (which hadn't been touched, minus the few small, trial bites). It wasn't worth arguing about, but we were most disappointed with the service and the handling of the situation (the server/restaurant could have simply comped the pizza, right?!). While the ambiance of Richardson's (and all other food we tried) was great, we wish they could have better handled the situation of a seriously bad plate. For this, we will never return or recommend this restaurant to anyone.

It's Saturday morning at 11:27 am, and I should be at Richardson's savoring a Richardsons combo with a jalapeño benedict (with pork loin and jalapeño hollandaise) and two chicken enchiladas with both red and green sauce (why settle when you can have both).  I would also even have some of the asparagus they throw on the plate so you can feel that you had a healthy meal.  I should be washing it all down with a bloody mary requested to be "just a little spicy", so that it has just enough of a spicy kick for me.  Or maybe I should branch out and have the carne adovada and eggs or huevos rancheros or anything on that wonderful brunch menu.  And maybe I should go a second time to award the coveted 5th star, just to make sure it's excellence was not a fluke.  But instead, I'm writing about it.  Should have, could have, would have, but didn't.  Well this is just depressing, so I'm headed to the tamale festival instead.  But I'm thinking Richardson's tomorrow.

We have been frequenting Richardson's for the last three years at least 3-4 times a month. The last time we visited the hostess sat us in what I like to refer to as the concrete-hole booth where no one can see you and you cannot see out (if you've been there you know which one I'm talking about). The hostess then neglected telling our server we were there so we sat in the concrete abyss for nearly 15 minutes before our server peeked over the wall at us. That visit ended well as the server knew how upset we were and did everything she could to make it right.   However, today we had a server I never met before. She left us sit for a while too, but we were in full view of her and every other staff member. When she finally came to our table, we inquired about chocolate milk for my granddaughter and received an emphatic "NO", not "No, I'm sorry we don't have chocolate milk but we do have..." just a rude abrupt NO followed by silence. Then my scrambled eggs arrived with the entire top of the pile just sort of jellied, not runny but definitely 'jellied'. She kindly took them back to the kitchen to throw back on the grill for a second or two. She returned with a plate of rubbery, burnt eggs and told me next time I need to request "hard scrambled". Well, NO dear lady, next time I would like my eggs scrambled the way they should be, soft and fluffy with no jellied grossness hanging around the top or the middle. We then sat, and sat,  and sat, and sat staring at my pile of uneaten food and my companions dirty dishes. When she ignored us and walked away one last time I said, "Excuse me Ma'am. Can we get our check please." At this point I was met with a rude "Give me a minute!" accompanied by a feisty glare. My husband then suggested maybe I should wait outside while he settled the bill. Good thing for her I took his advice because I don't generally respond well to rude, feisty glares.   Richardson's... I am sorely disappointed and this last experience will probably keep me from coming back because if you try to seat me in that girls station I'll get up and leave. You should do the math: 3-4 times a month at nearly $100 a pop. That's a lot of lost revenue.  And since I'll be sure to share my experience with others, you should remember, word of mouth is a powerful advertising tool as well.   I used to love you. Now I'm just booooooo Richardson's, I'm taking my money down the street.

This place is the most amazing ambience and food I have had in a long time! I loved it! They have Rye!!! As in Whiskey!   Very cool vibe and the food was so good. I even tried to come home and copy their Roasted Green Chili Baked potato... I didn't do it justice, so I will need to go back and have it again.   The place is small, and the parking non-existent, but they have complimentary valet and that helps. Get there early or make sure to make reservations.   LOVED THIS PLACE! Loved everything about it!

I would like to try Richardson's again. I went on a date here and we were going to order a couple things off the menu, but the manager said, "Let me take care of you- you're going to love this". We looked at each other (date and I) and were like, "Ok, I guess".  The manager sent out a garlic plate. It wasn't the worst thing for a date, since roasted garlic isn't stinky, but it was a cheesy heavy gross mess for me. I'm not into that kind of food at all and would have much preferred to choose something different. It was huge as well, we couldn't even finish it and didn't have any room to try any entrees on the menu.   So, well, next time I know better and will stick to my own palate preferences rather than be persuaded by  a stranger that thinks first date food should be the size and style of a fancy superbowl platter. The dish wasn't gross, but it was incredibly heavy for 2 people. i might order that as an app if I was with a party of 4 or larger.  Overall, the place is beautiful and it's a great date spot. Call ahead and make a reservation though. I hope one day I can go again and try something that I like better.

We're in town from Los Angeles and found this spot on BringFido.  Once again, BringFido delivers!  We were immediately greeted with a bowl of ice water for the pups and seated on the cool, shaded patio.  Overhead fans keep the area in the 70's in spite of triple-digit temperatures outside.  The chips and salsa are a MUST (housemade warm chips and 3 amazing salsas).  Very dog friendly (they have pork and chicken menu options for your pups at a reasonable price), and service and food were impeccable.  I had the New Mexican platter with a sampling of dishes - cheese relleno (excellent - my favorite!), chicken burrito (moist and flavorful), bacon-wrapped shrimp, rice and beans and red and green chile sauces.  The presentation was beautiful and the portions were enormous!  Paired with a margarita, it was a very memorable meal.  Service is warm and friendly here.  They clearly care about your experience.

Ouch, where do I start? I should have known better when I realized they only had valet. Our dear friends recommended this place and were meeting us there, that is the only reason we stayed. We asked for self parking and they said to park at Runner's Den.... now I am wondering if they have an agreement with them or if they send people there just because. We sat and were welcomed by "Absolutely no split plates" and "no separate checks" notes on our menus. : ) Friendly business, uh? Our server was pushing for appetizers (asked multiple times before and after our friends arrived), but once we were ready to order she was nowhere to be seen for a while.  We also asked for straws and she gave them to us grabbing them from the top where your lips are supposed to go! I think that was by far the worse. Other than that she was OK and friendly. I do not know anything about New Mexico food but I do not have respect for places that spell adovada with a 'v', and that do not peel the green chiles : o Over all I thought the place was kind of 'uppity' for my taste (I am a very very simple gal), and I would at least have expected them to have options for artificial sweeteners, but they (oh surprise) only had the pink saccharine ones. OK, enough bickering : ) The food was good, the portions (other than the adovada) were generous and everyone agreed they were tasty. I think one of our friends had the New Mexico plate and it was huge. I am OK with the food, but for the prices they have I would expect excellent customer service and Stevia, Splenda or at least Nutrasweet. I am on a special diet but was even afraid to ask, lol... The hostess was very nice and friendly.

Love this place. Great staff. Great food. Great environment. Tops all around.   I recommend the specials. Their fish is fantastic. The prime rib is ridiculously good.  Everything on the menu is top-notch. I especially like the sausages, so give everything a try it's worth it.

This is a touch of class infused with New Mexican style cuisine. Steeped deep with Hatch Green Chilies and New Mexican/Southwestern flair, these dishes are well conceived and incredible. The flavors abound and melt in your mouth.  The dining areas are upscale even though the dress code is not. The outside bar at the Rokerij is a treat and lends easy access to either dining location. There are a wide array of draft beers on tap, as well as a fairly extensive wine list that is sure to please any palate.  Twyla and I had the New Mexican Enchiladas that were well prepared and delicious. These gems showcase just enough heat to keep you alert but not so much that your ordering milk with dinner. The dress is casual and the ambiance is intimate. This is great date place to sit, chat, enjoy vino and find out what a weirdo you met on Mingle; kidding! However, whether a special occasion, chilling with the crew or a night out with that certain someone, Richardson's and the RokeriJ will fit the bill nicely. Check out their menus on line...  #Vino2 #Vino2ultimate #Vinosquared #IrishcatV2  #jimsboisset

I asked for a straw for my water and the server told me that they aren't allowed to give out straws anymore, that it "came from the top".  Meanwhile, my boyfriend sees a glass at the bar completely filled with straws (as well as bar sitting customers' drinks with straws) so he gets up and takes one.  The next thing we know, someone has put the glass of straws out of sight.  The server comes to check on us, notices the straw in my drink and asks me where I got it.  Are you kidding me???  At $40+ a person she is going to interrogate me about a straw?  How dare they!!!!    Well they just lost previously loyal customers who have been coming her for over 18 years!!!!

Food was good, drinks were alright, our server, Michelle was sweet but it didn't really seem like she knew what she was doing... She didn't mention any of the drink specials and did not pace any of our food out, so it all came at once. And then she brought us the check when we didn't even ask for it? It was our cousins 50th birthday and we spent quite a bit of money. Perhaps she is new and in need of more training....?

Their 3 and a half star overall rating is quite generous, in my opinion. The ambiance...eh. The food...heed the warnings regarding portions! I have no problems with taking food home so it doesn't go to waste but, this was nowhere near good enough to even bother. Humongous and ridiculous are the first 2 words that pop into my head. SHARE! We had issues with seating and service but, I was waiting on the food to determine my final opinion. I'm not impressed with the flavor at all. My mom and I had Chimayo Chicken. Asiago is great in moderation. The Chimayo Chicken is not only stuffed with Asiago but, also served on a BED of Asiago! The medley vegetables are...just...a weird combination and not cooked enough. I like my steamed veggies cooked until there is just a bit of crunch. These were way undercooked. The "home of the green chile potato" dish was very bland. I definitely expected more since it's a signature dish. Besides being bland it didn't look or taste fresh. It seemed reheated to me. If it wasn't reheated keep that in mind for the taste you expect. Just overall terrible really. Will never go back.

Good food, terrible service. Maybe nice for a bar dinner for two, but definitely not kid-friendly.  We went today to catch a celebratory brunch for a few family achievements. My wife and I tow along a toddler and an infant, and we wanted to get a table for 6, for the other family coming in. The hostess looked at us like we were blood-stained hobos or something, and seemed oh-so-upset that she had to take us to our table. When we asked if there were high chairs or accommodations for the infant in the car seat, she flatly replied no and suggested we could put our infant on the floor. You know, totally normal restaurant practice.  The staff, from bus boy to waiters, seemed to do just the bare minimum. No smiles or friendly talk, and it was almost like they didn't want to make eye contact. I'm Asian so with my squinty eyes I can understand if people have a hard time making eye contact. But my in-laws have perfectly normal eyes. One waitress, who was also attending at the bar, was nice enough to talk to us a bit, but was too busy and eventually had to ask another grumpy person to take care of us.   Anytime we had questions, like whether we could sit outside, or where the restroom is, or, oh I don't know, if we could I have a water refill, we'd be met with what looked like eye-rolling. We all felt uncomfortable. I actually felt relieved to leave, eventually.   Food was nice, but not good enough to warrant coming back for.

I've been going here for 9 years solid. The most heartbreaking thing is seeimg how the management, staff, and cooks have been turned over so much lately. The service quality is nothing like it usedd to be. And the food quality is declining each time I return. The guys at the Hideaway are the only people keeping this place alive in my opinion. Damn, I hope the day never comes when I say this place sucks!

Incredible ambience and amazing food.  Very different than your average Mexican food spot.  Things are spicy since its New Mexican flavor so be prepared.  A hole on the wall spot that doesn't get as much attention that it deserves.

Came here with my family. Have been coming here for years. My step dad Alex is friends with Eric and Phil. We waited for more than 40min to get seated and noticed 2 people got seated ahead of us when they had came minutes after us. We spoke with the manager Clark and instead of just saying he would speak with the people who are in charge of seating us, he kept talking back to my step dad. I don't know what happened to customer service, but it has gone down slowly. Very disappointed.

Food is 5 Star stuff  Service was AWEFUL! From the moment we sat down, our server, an older blonde lady, was rude, passive aggressive and truly toxic.  Carne Adovada was amazing! Margaritas were solid but overpriced.  It is a total shame when a server ruins an entire evening. $375.00 check for 8 people. You would think she would try a little kindness considering there is a pretty good tip coming their way.  Oh well, maybe next time. The bus boy was nice!

What a disaster! Our food was late, they lost our orders, they do not take separate checks. The food, when it finally came, was very good but the service was worse than any place I have ever ate in my life. This is 2.5 hrs of my life I will never recover.

My wife and I went here for dinner while staying at the Four Seasons. Food was delicious and our waiter was such a nice guy. Very helpful in guiding us through the menu and making sure we tried the top Dishes. The tostadas, quesadilla, enchiladas, and pork abodabo were all awesome. Our eyes were bigger than our stomachs - but we got plenty to take home for leftovers.

My favorite place for a hearty breakfast and memories of home (Though I've lived a lot of places, I claim New Mexico). There is NOTHING like good chile and it's near impossible to find after crossing the NM state line. The adovada and the shrimp enchiladas here meet the challenge!  ...So do the huevos rancheros.   Heck!   You really can't go wrong! (And,  YAY for $5 mimosas!)  And for dinner, my favorite is the pork tenderloin, moist and sweet, basted with a green and red chili jelly and the "famous" GCP (a chile stuffed with cheesy mashed potatoes and baked).  As much as I like the hip Dick's Hideaway location, I'm grateful for a greater shot at a table and the "new" Richardson's location just a smidge up the street.

Wow. Do not dine here. Please let me list the reasons why...  Made a reservation three weeks in advance for a seven top reso for a bunch of Chicago 20 something's in town to go out and have a great night in Phoenix.  Our server was non existent throughout our entire dinner... Our plan was to dine... Translation, spend money! No one was served more than one cocktail. When asked what to order, we were answered with; everything is good. We relied on one girl who has been here before to walk us through the menu. Food came out staggered, and when the food arrived, we asked the food runner (who was clearly the rude host with short spiked boy hair) which entree had meat and which had cheese... (We had a vegetarian in the group) she responded with, "I don't know, this is not my job" Okay, really?! As we are all completely done with this place, and parched because our waters hadn't been refilled on the 90 degree patio. I thought that I should just let the manager know about how much money they lost out on, and more importantly how neglectful his sever was. His response; I wish you would have told me earlier so that I could have fixed it. (Mind you, our entrees were still on the table) No, I'm sorry, no, let me send you dessert. No, apology or care for my complaint in anyway.... Talk about one, the server. Two, the host/food runner. Three, the MANAGER... Dropping the ball! Needless to say, we will never be back. We have now wrote this review, so hopefully other people don't go here. And lastly, to whom ever reads this internally. Find a manager who values the customer... And get a training program in place for all your other staff members who interact with the people who pay your bills.

Sensational Carne Adova. I normally don't like beans, but this place changed my mind. The tortillas are fluffy, and the smoked pork is unbelievably tender. The decor is eye catching and features tables made of copper. This place is busy and rightly so!

This is my brothers favorite restaurant in Phoenix and he and his GF took me and my husband here for Easter Brunch when we were visiting. Who knew the food scene in Phoenix was so hip and classy? They have really great food and the decor is super. Punched copper bar, adobe like ambiance, with a fire pit and outdoor seating that looks really cozy. New Mexican cuisine is one of my favorites so it already had me at hello. The menu is really classic mexican-ish with a tweek of gourmet. Such as Huevos Rancheros with Crab or what have you. We had blood orange juice, yum-, a Garlic Plate app. Was out of this world with roasted elephant garlic bulbs and several kind of cheeses melted over red and green fire roasted chile salsa and onions and little crustinis to use like a bruchetta I am guessing, which was clever. My Chile Relleno was really great, everything cooked perfect. Hubby got chile verde and eggs (forgive me I dont know the exact name of the dishes) he loved it. My brother and his girlfried said they havent had anything they didnt love. Its one of those places that makes you wanna stay a while...you can tell the owner really takes pride. I hope you go check this out when visiting Phoenix because its really worth the trip!

I am not sure if I just dislike Mexican fusion, so I have to preface with that. I don't think I do. The waitstaff was very friendly. The food was mediocre. I had a special, tilapia with cheese. It was OK. Tasted like something I could do. The other three diners seemed to enjoy their food. I think it was a little overpriced too.

Amazing New Mexico cuisine!  I highly recommend the Carne Adovada with eggs for brunch or dinner... It has so much flavor with just the right amount of heat to make it enjoyable to the pallet.  My next favorite is the chili relleno stuffed with pork.  Can't get enough of this place.  Our server Susanna was amazing and is a definite must to sit in her area.  Great food and great service, what a winning combination!

LOVE IT LOVE IT!! Every entree is delicious but the Sea Bass is the best outstanding and I order it every time we go to Richardsons. We love to take friends there to introduce them to the quality of food and comfortable environment. It's on the top of our list of Best Restaurants in the Valley!

They are open again!  The green chili soup is delicious and is like playing Russian Roulette.  Sometimes it's super spicy, sometimes its manageable.  Pork Adovada is the standard here.  What I like is that you can also order off of the Rokerij menu and the wine menu is exactly the same which is nice.  They have a great patio which you should take advantage of if you can.  I'm still annoyed that they can't just give you a chile relleno a la carte, you have to get the entire plate.  These are the quirks that you deal with when you come here.   The service is friendly and yes the prices are still a dollar or two, too high, but then again, it looks exactly like the old restaurant, so the same gripes and same good stuff are all there.

What's the deal with Rokerij and Richardson's?  We thought we were hanging out at Rokerij and it turned out to be Richardson's.  They aren't the same place but they are in the same place?  The valet parking is set up so that it drops you off at Richardson's entrance, see the confusion?  As we were sitting there I remember thinking, "I don't know what all the fuss is about."  The oysters were good, the wine was alright, the ambiance was okay - western decor isn't really my thing.  My friend and I sat at the bar and the bartender was sweet but not really attentive.  Hopefully we'll pick door number two next time and end up at the right place.
How anyone can rate this place below five stars is ridiculous!!  Everything from the excellent service to the tasty and perfectly mixed margaritas to the perfectly spiced eats -- simply amazing!!!!

This is as New Mexico as it gets. Everything from the Spanish tile on the floor to the decor and artwork in the building. This was my second time here and both times I left very satisfied with my meal and the service. As a warning you should like spicy foods if you are going to try this spot. The Adovado and New Mexican Enchilada are the 2 plates I have eaten. Both were really good. I am definitely making this a spot to stop at when craving a spicy dish. It can be pricy and is a bit upscale.

Took clients here for lunch.   If you like spicy southwestern food, this is the place for you.   One of my clients even ordered a side of habanero salsa cause it wasn't quite spicy enough.   Guess what??  That sauce could be considered a bit on the hot side!    Since we were celebrating an almost closing on their house, she had the mimosa, and he and I had the bloody mary.   I don't normally order bloody marys, but even that was a bit on the spicy side.   It was good, though.   If I was into bloody marys, that's what I'd get, at least, from here.   I like the spiciness of it.  I ordered my standard carne adovada, he had the corn enchiladas and she had the pork carnitas.   (Or was it the other way around??)  Still love the carne adovada.   It comes with rice and beans, and I added some of the habanero salsa as well.   They both stated they loved what they ordered albeit he said his enchiladas was a bit spicy.  I definitely would come here again.   It's my go to place for southwestern food in the desert.

I have been a big fan of Richardson's since its old location and love it and its sister restaurants, Dick's and Rockerij.  The food is fantastic, creative and always hot which is something I really like.  Went there today for lunch and the food did not disappoint.  The service, however, was a different matter.  Our waitress was not pleasant and either completely overwhelmed or just incapable.  We would have had at least two additional rounds of drinks for the 5 of us but we had a tough time finding our waitress.  Even getting our water glasses refilled was tough.  We actually had to go find someone it was so bad.  We asked her for an additional silver setup which she brought but when we again asked for more water and if she could find our waitress so we could order more drinks, we got attitude and the its not my section look.  In addition to being non existent for most of the visit when she was around our waitress was really bit**y and showed no personality or interest in us being there.  We were there for almost two hours to get through lunch and while the food was good, its tough to enjoy when you can't even get a glass of water.  Lastly, we ordered red beers and rather than charging us the $3.50 beer price plus some amount for a little hot sauce we got billed for full on bloody Mary's.  Not a big deal but didn't really seem right.  We will ultimately go back but with their understaffed or just poorly trained service they missed out on an additional $70 in drinks from our table alone and probably one or two visits over the next month until we just can't stay away any longer.  Really hoping the next experience will be better.

Typically someplace we'd come for fantastic Mexican-infused munchies & drinks. The wait staff and bar tenders were always professional and attentive, and the food was fresh and had rich flavors, as well as a chill energy. The downstairs bar was like a groovy cave, dimly lit and a din with chatter and music. Tonight was different: the wait staff fell far short of expectations, as did the food. The salad drenched in dressing, the fish -- fishy, and the pasta way short of al dente. Maybe it was a fluke, but it felt more like commercial TexMex in ambiance, disinterested service, and in a dull, super salty, and unhealthy cuisine. I hope management gets itself centered and focuses on doing things the right way. Too expensive to be disappointing.

I had lunch here one afternoon when it was surprisingly not crowded. I am giving four stars for an always cozy atmosphere and a nice patio.  I had the enchiladas which had a nice kick, especially the pork. But the quality if the food in relation to the price is what gets me. Everything is good but not great enough to warrant the prices. And the service is almost always lacking.  This particular time, we seemed to be the victim of our server going on break and their being a breakdown in communication or coordination. In any case, we had to  wait a while before our drinks were refilled and my salad was forgotten. Our server was nice and apologetic so no worries. Not always the case as some servers make it clear that they are way above looking after the likes of us.  So overall, not a bad place, the prices, quality and atttiude serve as enough of a deterrent to patronize again in the future.

My family went to Richardson's for dinner and it was the WORST dining experience any of us has EVER HAD.   I cannot believe that any good reviews of this restaurant are real. To start, the food was terrible. All the plates came out separately and my moms almost 15 minutes after everyone else's. Her meal had been over cooked for so long the food was burnt and stuck to the plate. The kitchen staff and our waiter had obviously forgotten about it. Our waiter had also forgotten to ring in appetizers on 2 separate occasions... the 2nd time the item never did make it to the table. When we told the waiter about my moms dinner he rolled his eyes and said "it's supposed to be hot" and then walked off while we were still talking to him. Next thing I know another staff member walks up and just starts clearing off everyone else's plate from the table without asking if anyone else was done...which we weren't. Then our waiter shows up again with the bill. DUDE... WHAT?   5 minutes later another guy comes up and asks: NOW are you done? I said no I wasn't and he responded --Well, I wasn't talking to YOU!! Needless to say everyone was beyond rude and has no business being in the customer service industry.   We all agreed that the staff is on drugs. I am not joking around when I say that. Their behavior and mannerisms were not normal. Oh and we all got the shits from the little food that we did eat. Having the runs while being hungry is the worst.

My first time here and I have to say, it did not live up to its expectations. From the moment we got there, the hostess was rude and when I asked if they could turn the air up before my friend turned into a popsicle, we were declined. I then asked if we could turn the fan off right above us and she still said no without any explanation. I ordered the shrimp enchiladas and I would say there was MAYBE three pieces of shrimp in the entire dish.   Splitting up the check was a nightmare since we were told they dont do seprate checks , she came over probably every two minutes to make sure we were moving along in the bill splitting process. It was not relaxing, enjoyable or worthwhile. It was a going away dinner for one of my friends and I was sad to say that upon leaving, I knew she wasn't thrilled with the service or the food.

went on a tuesday, not too busy.  i had the sea bass, others had the porterhouse.  service was good, seabass was excellent.  portions are quite large so i would stay away from appetizers.  overall good southwestern food.  nice bar and outside lounge area.
My daughter recommended this Resturant & said the food was good & a fun place. We loved it & plan to go back soon!  She was right on!
We went for a friend's birthday and were impressed with the food.  The service was average, but the ambience made up for it. It looks like it has an excellent happy hour.

My husband and I enjoyed Richardson's for years and were devastated when the original location burned down. Until recently, we hadn't had an opportunity to visit the new location that's in the same building as Rokerji, but some friends came to visit and we decided to take them. I have to say that we were delighted to see that the decor was exactly as it was in the original restaurant! The service was as fantastic as it's always been, and the food is unparalleled. Everything is prepared perfectly. I highly recommend the pinenut encrusted sea bass!

I come here every time I'm in PHX.  Great wine superb food awesome atmosphere.  Service usually excellent except during crunch times.  Definitely get a reservation or expect to wait!  Osso bucco is phenominal!!!

Have you heard of New Mexican food? Let's be clear, I'm not talking about Mexican (at least that's what the locals in the area want you to believe)... my take? Mexican, New Mexican, who cares? IT'S SO GOOD!  Margaritas are strong and tasty. Portions are large and delicious. If you get a combo you're in for a mix of meat/poultry/fish (your choice), beans, rice, cheese, diced tomatoes... the works. The cheese brings it all together and presto - you've got yourself one hell of a New Mexican meal =)  Three salsas served to start, one has a great kick. I can't promise you'll be able to really distinguish between Mexican and New Mexican, but I can promise you'll enjoy your meal.

You fill up quickly in this place.  My wife has always told me how much she loved New Mexican from a summer spent there and this upscale rendering did not dissapoint.    I had a gimlet with a splash of grapefruit juice.  It was good  but with no room at the bar while we waited (make reservations of you have a chance) as they used it primarily as overflow for dinners at both bars and told not to go downstairs to the bar as no cell service down there...  We were offered a chance to dine at the bar and debated but decided against it which seemed to irk the hostess a bit.  We started with the scallops which were grilled perfectly, huge and on a flour tortilla which contained rice, beans, queso and green chillies.  Really wish I had taken a pic.  5 stars for this dish!   I had the New Mexican which included bacon wrapped grilled shrimp, chicken enchilada in red and green Chile sauce and a cheese relleno.  The cheese relleno which was not fully melted in the middle.  Not only hard but also a bit cold in the middle.  I would give 4 stars but the bar situation and no real waiting area irked me a little.  I give 3.5 stars for this, 4 but for the relleno.    We will be back!

After not having been to Richardson's before they relocated I was less than impressed.  I remembered well the prickly pear margarita that was so good and when I tried it again all i could taste was sweet...no tequila. The service was severely lacking.  We ordered appetizer and had to ask twice as to where they were..  They also refused to put us on separate checks which most restaurants will do. The busboy was actually more helpful than the waitress.  This was actually wasted money as far as I was concerned..The only saving grace were the chili relleno's were pretty good.

French toast , eggs and hashbrowns! Yum! What an amazing breakfast! The portions here are big plan on splitting it with your bestie or a significant other!  The outdoor seating is phenomenal i love the bar and high tops for amazing and personal service and conversation with you wait staff.

This place is definitely worth a try. My family and I came here for a nice hearty brunch and we were not disappointed.   All the dishes we tried were so flavorful. I tried the enchiladas: tried one cheese and one green chile pork. The green chile pork was my favorite. My husband had the carne adovada benedict. I will definitely order that next time. The meat was so tender and had a great smokiness to the red chile. The only downside to the meal was that all over our eggs were over cooked. I didn't send the eggs back but my father did and they were happy to give him eggs cooked to his liking. Overall, we were happy with our experience at Richardson's.  Also, just a heads up, they have valet. I'm not sure if they always have valet but they had it when we went.

So we came here after finding out Rokerij doesn't serve the new Mexican food anymore. My Lil Sis was in town and the rellenos were a must ! My Mom, both Sisters and I came on our girls day after the art museum and shopping. It was the perfect way to end the day ! Our food was amazing !!!!!! The enchiladas and rellenos were out of the world !!! All I wanted in life at that moment ! I also tried the carne adovada and cordon bleu, they were very good also. We had the skewers thinking that were like the rokerij version, but they weren't, still good though. We finished with the flan and sopapillas. The flan was really good. I am not crazy about flan, but I really enjoyed theirs. The sopapillas were good, not authentic, but still very good. I appreciated the density even though it isn't how I have always known them to be.

Such a cool space! The outdoor patio is absolutely beautiful & would be the perfect spot for a group dinner. We sat inside for lunch & started with chips and guac. For my entree I ordered the special of the day, the blackened mahi spinach salad. Huge portion - essentially there was an entire piece of fish on top of a bed of spinach. Definitely couldn't eat the entire thing.  Their happy hour deals look amazing - I'm sure I'll be back!

Went to richardsons recently for the first time after hearing a lot about it from a friend. The environment was awesome and the staff are super friendly. Our server was Brooke, and she was very friendly and knowledgable about the wine and food. She also took the time to explain the menu to me because it was my first time, and it was much appreciated since she was so busy. Food was out of this world! All together a wonderful experience and I am definitely coming back in the near future!

We took friends out to dinner last Saturday night- food was a 4 but service was horrible which is why we give the restaurant a 1.  First- it took 2 calls to get a reservation.  When we initially called, the woman that answered said she had to "confirm with her manager" and would get back with us in 48 hours.  After receiving no call back for four days, I had to call them back.  Next, at the table, the waiter just could not fathom or remember that our friend was unable to have milk product.  Even after the loooonnng, drawn-out conversation while ordering, he STILL brought her salad with cheese on it (totally discussed during the ordering process).  Finally, and this is the biggest downer of the evening, the bill seemed high and I couldn't see well in the restaurant because of the dimmed lights, but I signed it and paid.  Next day I look it over... We were totally OVERCHARGED... charged for 2 drinks we never had, and the drinks we actually ordered we wrong on the bill.  OVERCHARGED!!!  Don't trust this restaurant... I tried to contact them 4 days ago, received a VM that said to leave a message and they would call back.  No call back.  I left another message a bit ago.  This is seeming like a scam... I'm about to go to the authorities and report it... Very frustrating.  We will not be back and I don't think you should consider going.
This place is amazing!! Best New Mexican grille around!! Breakfast is our favorite time to go!! Especially on the outside patio!!

Yes! I don't know why I have waited so long to leave this place a 5 star review... The food is to die for. The food here is always in big portions but is the best food I have tasted, you can order anything on the menu and be satisfied. My favorites are the benedicts. They have delicious bloody mary's and never leave you with your glass empty. They are open on almost every holiday serving the valley. I recommend this place to all of my friends.

I just had l lunch here. The enchiladas were excellent! The red chile is hotter than the green chile and both were very good. I finished off with the sopapillas. The outdoor patio has a fireplace for temperate desert evenings. I ate at the beautiful brass bar. I definitely recommend this place.

Had family in town and wanted to take them to one of my favorite places in The Valley. I should have gone with my gut and not taken the 9:15 reservation but they really wanted to eat here. We were seated at about 9:30 and they were definitely not ready for us. We received water right away and then were assured by the manager that we would be well taken care of. We didn't see our waitress for 15 minutes after that. She was good and very nice considering she was our bartender for an hour and a half while we were waiting for our table drinking. We wanted a pizza and they said they weren't serving them anymore?  Ordered our apps. and they were good. Ordered our dinners and the Caesar salads came out without dressing. Ouch. Dinners were OK. Just not as good as every time else I have been there. Oh well. Maybe it was too late in the evening.

What a wonderful evening to start out with happy hour and mike I or ( my guy ) excellent food from grilled shrimp to creme burlee fun friend, tequila ... Had a great time mike was on top of it at least we were one of few customers on the patio .

Hour plus wait after ordering. Nobody came to check on us during wait. Brought all three meals out separately and left the child until last. Poor execution. Daughter is crying.   Place is all fail today   Food was excellent as always however.
Great food! Pork chop was a tad over cooked but flavors are amazing! Fish specials are the way to go. Lots of food, great service and atmosphere. I only wish I could cook with that much flavor.

Another GREAT restaurant. From the cocktails, to the appetizers, the main course, and the after dinner drinks, this was one of the best dining experiences I've had. I ordered the Carne Adovada but substituted a green chili potato for the rice and beans, and it was uh-MAZING. My husband got the Pork Mole, and if I hadn't loved my dish so much, I would've traded him.   I only wish it wasn't such a drive, because their happy hour items look just as good as everything else I had. Next time I'm in town, Richardson's, I've got a hot date with you.

I came to Richardson's straight from the PHX airport.  I was eager to eat good food and be outside as I had just came from Chicago aka Chi-beria (-9 degrees).  I was on a business trip, so I sat alone at the outdoor bar.  The bar tender was really friendly and whipped me up a skinny margarita (which was very refreshing).  The menu is huge and they also have a lot of specials.  I should've looked on Yelp prior to ordering to get some guidance on what was best.  I ended up with a fish special - Mahi Mahi w/ mango salsa, ranchero mashed potatoes, and broccolini.  I wanted so badly to give Richardson's four stars, but two things held me up:  1) Side salad was served w/ ranch...maybe I am being too harsh, but ranch dressing is one of the worst dressings for you and they could've offered me another alternative. 2) Mahi Mahi had a bit of a sour flavor (not sure how to describe it) and was kind of tough  Otherwise, the dish was plated very lovely - very colorful!  The mashed potatoes were served in a jalapeno.  The broccolini and asparagus were cooked perfectly and had a corn sauce over them.  The mango salsa was not very ripe, so it was not very sweet as I had expected.  I love the ambiance here and I would definitely come back to try one of their other many dishes.
Food is awesome being from NM- like amazing. But service - being in the industry.. ehh.

The food was good - I had the scallops which had three different sauces and beans and rice. My husband had the kabobs (I assume they were good as he didn't save any for me to taste!) I had a glass of wine however, the drink of the night was the prickly pear margarita. Not too sweet and very easy to drink. The only reason for the 4 star review was the service was not good at the start.

Came here on a Sunday for lunch and was seated inside in the bar area. My husband sat down and the cushion he was sitting on was soaking wet. His pants then became wet and when we told the waiter she just said sorry and took the whole cushion/pillows off. We had a sleeping baby in the car seat carrier and the waitress was pretty loud which woke her up. I know it wasn't really her fault really but that made me a little annoyed since I had to hold the baby the entire time now instead of enjoying my meal. It took a little for the food to get there and refills weren't very often. Had to ask her twice for another sprite. The food itself was okay. We came during brunch so maybe if we come during lunch or dinner and try out the menu things might change but the brunch/breakfast wasn't worth it for me. But my husband and brother liked what they ordered.
Their food is just too good to not give them 5 stars even if sometimes the staff is a little slow.  Good food is worth the wait!

This is such a shame. My boyfriend and I came here last Valentine's Day, to walk into the restaurant and find out that they lost our reservation that was made weeks in advanced, and called the day before to confirm our reservation. Then we get there and they lost our reservation, we had to wait 45 minutes to be seated. THEN! We had a bunch of family in town so we figured to come back because their food is really really delicious . We brought my 92 year old grandma and 9 other family members. We walk in and they LOST OUR RESERVATION again? For the 2nd time!!!!! I mean this is just he most annoying thing ever! My grandma is in her walker so this was like the worst thing to happen at a restaurant. The food is incredible which is why this is just so unfortunate. I hate writing bad reviews but this just is soooo not right.

The food here is pretty good- The chili Relleno in particular. They have a large menu and offer a good selection of drinks as well.   They have one major problem here, the flies! If you sit outside, it is almost unbearable due to the abundant amount of flies. I have come for happy hour a few time and they only do happy hour at the bar outside, so you are forced to sit in a swarm of flies.   The service here is also not very good and the servers are pretty inattentive.   I probably will pass next time I am invited to eat here, as I do not like flies all around me at anytime, in particular when I eat!   I went to another resturant in Phoenix that introduced a type of bee that does not sting people but it eats flies! Richardson's should look into this.

How this place has less than 4 starts is beyond me.  This is the best New Mexican food you can find outside of NM and one of the best restaurants in all of phoenix. The food is incredible (get the carne adovada or the chile rellenos) and the bar selection is great.  Service is good and atmosphere is great.  Fantastic place.
Food is alright. Service is garbage. You would expect a lot more from a place with the kind of prices they have. If anything, the food is what gave it the 2 stars...

THIS IS THE BEST PLACE FOR BREAKFAST!  We had been going to dicks for awhile now and one day we walked in and they said that it was full that morning,  and the waitress told us that Richardson's was up the road.  We never knew this was there.    We usually order the french toast which is AMAZING both Dicks and Richardson's serve the same breakfast.    Service is great and the coffee is even better!

I would give it zero starts if I could.  I would never eat in a restaurant that proudly states (in super small letters on their menu) that if you order it, you pay for it.  Really?  If they posted a sign in an obvious place that said that, I would have never walked in.  We had a group of 7, and an a waiter that seemed new and had no clue about the menu items.  We asked for something that wasn't spicy.  Four of the 7 of us sent back our cheese enchiladas, because they were inedible, and crazy spicy.  An arrogant guy, who called himself the manager, never came over to talk to us, until we went looking for him.  They refused to bring us something else without charging us again, he claimed he was standing by his small letters on the paper menu, and it was our problem.  Customer service at its absolute worst.  Everyone has an off night, but I would never return after that experience.

The atmosphere in this establishment is amazing. Love the cozy, romantic, dark feeling of the restaurant and the patio. Our plan on this chilly night was to sit on the patio and order from either Richardsons or Rokery, as we had several months prior. Apparently that is no longer an option, so we decided to go to Richardsons. When we entered, we inquired about happy hour, which is only at the bar, so we chose to sit at a booth, instead, and skip happy hour. We ordered a round of margaritas and our entrees. The food was good, but, for some reason, was not kind to my stomach later. The service was so-so. I agree the waitstaff acts like they are way too busy to be bothered with doing their job. Our waitress was standoff-ish and absent. We had to ask one of the other workers for drinks and extras, like napkins, etc. The place was not busy, so I am not sure what happened to our server. We may return for a romantic cocktail or to bring guests for a drink, but that will be the extent of our return.

My family and I have been patrons of Richardson's & the Rokerij for over 10 years. The service has always been so so, with condescending waiters, etc. but the food usually made up for the bad service. I mean we even returned several times after my sister found a rubber band in her pasta Heidi and still had to pay for the dish. However, our past few experiences have been sub-par. Service is worse than ever and the food does not make up for it anymore. It is either too spicy or severely overcooked and dry. It will be a while before we return!!

This review is super delayed, but I could not just forget to give this place the great recognition they deserve.  I recently moved to Oregon after living in AZ my entire life. I made my first trip back home to AZ to see my mom and sisters.The girls went out for a day filled with food, laughter, and love. We saved the BEST for last. RICHARDSON'S!!!!!!!  Between the 4 of us, we ordered some of the best items on the menu. Carne Adobada, Enchiladas, Mexican Chicken Cordon Blue, and ooooooohhhhh the Chili Relleno!!!!! Richardson's has the most impressive chili rellenos I have ever experienced. And I have experienced some freaking Rellenos!  I would not expect to find Mexican food this good out of a some what up scale restaurant in what my sister would call Cen Pho (FYI, I would NEVER call it that).  Great job Richardson's!!!!!
We had our best meal during our recent Scottsdale visit at Richardson's. My wife had the fish trio and I had the New Mexican surf and turf. So much of such amazing food.

One hour. That is how long we waited after ordering before we decided we would rather eat anywhere that wasn't here. A crushing, impressively underwhelming experience in lack of service.  We arrived and found:  Free valet parking? With a teensy parking lot, this works, thank you.   A good selection of indoor and outdoor seating? Also a plus.   Setting expectations and/or taking care of waiting customers? EPIC FAIL.  On a beautiful AZ autumn morning we came here (tho we entered Rockerij). We asked to be re-seated outside because inside of Rockerij is dark as a tomb and had loud conversation-intruding music. We were reseated by the fireplace and a waiter came over shortly to take our order. So far so good...or so we thought. 30 Mins after placing our order, I ask another waiter to check on the status of our food and he cleverly asks about what we ordered (exactly)...so we think it is being taken care of. 40 MINS after placing our order, I have still only had my coffee refilled once...and had to flag down another waiter to inquire about the status of our food again, because our actual waiter is nowhere to be found and the previous "drive-by" waiter never returned. A few mins beyond that, this guy actually comes back and indicates that our order is nearly ready and should only be a few minutes longer. Shortly thereafter OUR waiter stops by with comments of:   "I don't know why it's taking so long..." and "I put the ticket in right after I took your order..."  So...as a waiter...maybe it might be part of your job to check on the status of an order say...15mins after bringing it by the kitchen? Perchance? What do you think?  FIFTEEN (15 == few?) minutes later, we still had no food and I'd had quite enough. Out the door we went.  On a comical note: As we were outside (another 5 minute wait because the valet had our car either parked in Egypt somewhere or tandem?) our waiter came out to find us to let us know that our food was ready if we'd like to come back inside?  Oh R E A L L Y? The Clue-Delivery Train will be visiting you shortly. Facial cues you may want to look for in the future are: 1) the furrowed eyebrows 2) fuck-you facial expression and 3) curling fists  It seems that we are not alone in this. Courtney W.'s review (10/14/12) is representative of what we experienced.  I am dumbfounded how they have any good reviews. There must be a serious drought of sit down restaurants in this part of town, because this crap would never fly where I live. I cannot tell you how much I am looking forward to NEVER COMING HERE AGAIN.  P.S. They own 3 restaurants apparently: Richardson's, Rokerij, and Dick's Hideaway...all right in the same area (Rokerij and Richardson's being attached).   P.P.S. They all serve the same menu. It is NOT amazing. I have previously been to Dick's. Yes, it is good. No my socks did not come flying off.  P.P.P.S. ProTip: Drive down to Central Phoenix and go to Durant's, Portland's, Switch, or Fez. All of these places have exemplary service and food to match.

Wait was a bit but so worth it! Sat in the patio is was a nice night and the dim lighting made everything so relaxing.  I ordered the Chimayo chicken it was spicy but wonderful I couldn't stop eating it! My husband ordered the pork chop chorizo only expecting one pork chop but the plate came with two! He was pleasantly surprised. For the first time ever he took home leftovers!

Loved everything tonight, and always do when I come to Richardsons. Loved the chips, guacamole, salsas, and the chile rellenos. My friends loved the spicy chicken tostadas and the steak and shrimp plate. Just the right amount of spice in the food and in the waiter.

I first went to Richardson's 15 years ago when in Phoenix on business, and after that first fantastic meal, went there multiple times over the next few years.   Fast forward to this past Saturday night when I took my family there. I'd heard mixed reviews but wanted to see for myself if they could still pull off the kind of meal I remembered. I was not disappointed!  I had the sea bass in an orange salsa that was prepared perfectly, along with their famous green chili potato. The other three in my party had fish - the fish trio, the salmon and the swordfish. All were cooked to perfection.  Add an appetizer of chips with fresh guacamole, pico, and two green sauces, one to set your hair on fire and you have the total package. Finally topped it off with the house made flan - absolutely delicious.   Richardson's definitely passed the test of time. I'll definitely be going back.

How can a place with such great food have such terrible service....consistently terrible.  We went here for brunch and three of us got some variation of the carne adovada (there are multiple preparations available.); the other guest ordered the green chili stew.    All four meals were divine.  However, the service, the service, the service is still an issue.   We sat at the bar, and she didn't seem that busy.   Yet, she was too busy to take our orders....pretty much through the almost two hours we were there.   And I am almost positive I have never seen a manager on duty.  I am improving my rating from a 2 to a 3 because no one spilled anything on us and then pretended it didn't matter.

I organized a corporate dinner event for 50 employees. I had not been to Richardson's before, but had heard great reviews and was excited to host our event at this special space. I walked into the restaurant and was greeted with rude service from the start. A waitress actually yelled out behind me "MOVE!" It appears that the staff was overwhelmed and acted as though they did not know the specifics of our reservation, which we had gone over with the events person in detail weeks prior. After speaking with the manager, the service did improve and I have to say the food was fantastic. It is a beautiful, special space and they serve amazing food, but the service was not good.

Went to Richardson's with 2 other couples to specifically get authentic New Mexico Mexican cuisine. Since one couple are natives of Santa Fe we knew what we were after. Hatch green chili and chimayo red chili sauce. The food delivered, highly recommend the Carne Adovada which was amazing.  If the service would have been good I easily would have rated the restaurant a 4 or 5. Slow service and the waitress acted like we were a major inconvenience. We arrived at 9pm which for us is not an untypical dining hour so I'm not giving them a pass based on the time. We get great service at many other local places at this time.
The blackened swordfish was absolutely fantastic!  Great service and attention from the professional staff. I'd definitely come back!
I had really shitty service here, and the food was mediocre. I'm from New Mexico and was looking forward to some homestyle cuisine.

Came here for dinner with a large group. Everything was so delicious, I can't even choose. The appetizers were filling, so I barely was able to dig into the entree. I ordered the New Mexico Enchiladas. They were fabulous!!! I would come here again, for sure.

I can't believe I've never written a review of Richardson's.  How many times have I been in here?  Like, a million?  A billion?  A quadrillion?  Ok so it must be a smaller number, but enough to have gained a few lbs from their always delicious and always ample grub.     This also happens to be my (now) 19 y/o daughter's favorite restaurant in Phoenix and this is probably the 3rd year in a row we've had a birthday meal here.  This time since it was a workday, the girls came up and met me for lunch, which gave us the opportunity to enjoy items off the brunch menu (served till 4pm daily!).  We started with the (chorizo) Con Queso, which was amazeballs.      I had the Carne Adovada Benedict, which was one of the best bennies I've ever had, with pork that was super tender and flavorful soaked in their jalapeno hollandaise and, true to form, totally massive.  Two others had varying enchilada dishes, which they raved about, and another had the Huevos Rancheros, which she raved about as well.    Oldest daughter had a Prickly Pear Margarita which made her eyes go wide with enjoyment when she first tasted.  Winning!    Finally, our server brought our 19 y/o a trio of birthday mini-desserts - a cheesecake-in-a-pot (consistency of a pot de crème with the flavor of a cheesecake), a dense flourless chocolate cake and a crème brûlée.  The brûlée was her favorite.    We had good service and a good time!  Thanks again Richardson's!
The chile rellenos are delicious! I ordered the pork and smoked turkey. I wish the smoked turkey had been pulled apart more but this is a minimal issue. The green chile was the perfect sauce too.

This place was highly recommend by several people so I had to check it out.   My first impression was that the restaurant was way too dark inside. I had to use my phone flashlight to actually read the menu. I suggest sitting on the porch if at all possible. You'll be able to see better.   I ordered the New Mexico enchiladas and they were fantastic. I got a beef, pork, and chicken. I have to say out of the 3 the chicken was the best. Accompanied with the prickly pear margarita this meal was phenomenal.   If you enjoy spicy food ask for their spicy salsa. Great addition to the meal.
Took the wife to Richardsons for our fifth year anniversary splendid time in a little booth with great food and yummy bloody Mary's.

Went in on a Sunday night, great looking place and the service was on point. It was a little slow and the bartender chatted with us pretty much the entire time. What was suppose to be dinner and drinks, turned into an all nighter. The food was great, I had the enchilada plate and it was just packed with flavor. I haven't been I awhile but I may return soon and try something else, considering I live in the area there are just so many options that I still want to try around me.

Great Mexican food!  The blackened scallops (yes done mexicany) AWESOME!  Served with rice and beans in a skillet over a tortilla.  Heaven with a kick. Had the pumpkin cheesecake served in a tortilla shell.  This place is nice-great patio also.

Hi guy's just a BIG SHOUT OUT to all you guy's at Richardson's , Rokerij  and Dick's down the street all of you mix up lot's of great eat's  and drinks a Special shout out for the bartenders they ROCK  ,,,I recommend all of them ;  )

Awesome food, awesome service and an even more awesome patio!(three awesome's).   It's going to be 108 today but you wouldn't know it on the patio, Mattie took awesome care of us (and everyone else at the bar) and breakfast enchiladas and Mimosas can make anyone happy!  Skip the chains, skip the "new" places and go to one of the best brunch places in town!
Good food, awesome ambiance and the patio is beautiful!! Will definitely visit again.

I have wanted to write this review since our dinner at Richardson's.  Procrastination being the culprit.  I had read some iffy reviews of the new place, but we loved the old place too much not to give it a try.  Walking in to the restaurant was a bit of a shock.  I couldn't believe it was the exact same!!  That was a little weird, but in that the restaurant LOOKED the same, the food TASTED the same if not better!  Sea bass was perfect in every way! I had the chili rellenos which I love.  The sevice was wonderful! I believe his name was John.  I hope that is correct, because the reviews about service have been spotty at best, and he deserves a great review.  We will, definately, return to Richardson's, but not soon enough for me.  Glad to have it back!

Although expectation is the leading cause of disappointment, I'm here to set some expectations. As far as I'm concerned the individuals who rated this place "average" are some average joe's themselves. The ribs appetizer from this place was so tender and seasoned it was as if the me and the animal had shared a previous bond. This is the only place I've been to that the guacamole could be an actual dish in and of itself. The Chimayo Chicken(add Jalepeno hallandaise, you're welcome) was my entree of choice, and as you can tell from everything I've previously written it was knock your socks off and wash them for you; good. If they served the five stars I gave them, I would slap some jalapeño hollandaise on there and call it a meal.  Everything had just the right amount of spice to leave even the saltiest of critique's satisfied.

This is going to be in a weird order, so sorry.  First I want to say that this is a beautiful restaurant. In fact it is one of the most beautiful restaurants I can remember going to in the recent past. The neighborhood and the very exterior are Meh, but as soon as you walk through the gate, just gorgeous. Even though I can't recommend it, it seems like a great place to sit outside at during the nicer months. The inside is nicely decorated, dark and cozy. Place is fancyish.  If you like wine and drinking, and excellent food or great service isn't really high on your list of priorities for a dining establishment, I would recommend this place to bring a date. It's nice and dark, and if my experience is representative of their service, you'll have plenty of time to chat with your date uninterrupted.  Unfortunately for me, I don't have a lot of game, so I go ahead and eat at most restaurants I go to, since that is what they are there for. I want very badly to find a New Mexican restaurant I like on my side of town, and today this was the place.   I may have made a mistake by doing so, but I sat outside for a minute and read a few of the yelp reviews beforehand. What I was looking for was an idea of a great dish, what I found was a few too many mentions of poor service.   Some of the reviews mentioned condescension and patronizing responses, but I might have preferred that. I got a lack of attention as well as lack of friendliness/helpfulness. The onus should be on the server to get a dialogue going and get some rapport built. It would take minimal effort.   As far as the food, this place is a step above your normal family restaurant price-wise, so if they are justifying the prices on the food, I just could not see it. It was decent, but not "OMG this is great New Mexican food!" If you value your money and would be upset by wasting it, my advice would be to try it on your own before taking the financial bath of bringing your family.   There are plenty of decent Mexican places around far more reasonably priced, and this place just didn't justify the cost.   My search continues. I don't think I'll be back to Richardson's any time soon. Not worth it. Sad.
Some buddies and I recently had a great meal at Richardson's. Great atmosphere, great food. The wait staff was first-class and especially helpful. They're doing it right.

Excellent food, excellent service.  Had the skewers with some wine.  The food was flavorful and cooked nicely.  The setting in comfortable and clean with a nice ambiance.  An excellent choice for nice food, wine and a classy setting.
Fantastic New Mexico cuisine and ambiance. Especially lived the frint room' which is actually outdoors.

Richardson's is the best restaurant in Phoenix. They have delicious enchiladas, killer pico, succulent steaks and amazing prickly pear margaritas .  They open at 8am for breakfast so you can start your day with mimosas and end it with fine wine.  Been going to Richardson's , Dicks and Rockerij for over twenty years at least twice a week and, if company is in town, they want to go every day.  Staff is crazy good , they have a great patio for my dog , and they never fail to deliver excellence.  You want see much advertising for this restaurant group; they don't have to:  the locals show up every day.  Get there early or you won't  find a seat.  Enjoy!
Many people are recommending the Chimayo chicken & I agree it was delicious! I am from New Mexico so it is a little different but feels like home

I was really looking forward to eating at Richardsons but was unfortunately let down. My wife and I ordered 3 dishes and only one was worth eating.  The ceviche comes in a bowl of salsa with little fish. The garlic plate was okay but nothing to write home about.  Our final dish was the carne adobada. I loved this dish but it was a little too spicy for my wife.  The service was great however our first round of drinks tasted watered down and at $13 per drink, I would like it to taste like it contained alcohol.

To add to what many other Yelpers said: you really can't tell what is Richardson's and what is Rokerij; the free valet is very convenient, especially considering there is basically no lot; it is extremely dark inside, so don't plan on enjoying the appearance of your food; and MAKE A RESERVATION if you want to eat in Richardson's.  That being said, we had very good service - not super attentive, but I much prefer when servers don't spend a lot of time hovering.  All our meals were correct and everything was prompt but not rushed.  We went on a Tuesday, which happens to be half price bottles of wine night, so that was a great surprise.  I ordered the Posole to start.  It was VERY spicy but delicious.  We also had the chips and guacomole, with the 3 different salsas, and that was wonderful to start.  My husband ordered the enchilada platter and his father ordered the New Mexico platter.  They both loved their food, although it was alsy very spicy (the particular green chiles in their sauce were very spicy at least).    My mother-in-law had the skewers and it was fine.  I had the Pasta Heidi: green chili pasta with chicken and a chipotle cream sauce.  I literally could have died right then and been satisfied.  It was SO.  GOOD.  We literally can't wait to go back just so we can have the Pasta Heidi again.  My mouth is watering.  YUM.    I would also recommend checking out the basement bar, just to have a drink.  Have your server or a hostess show you how to get down there.  It's pretty cool, and a nice place to spend some time while you wait for your table.
Eggs Benedict Jalapeño is one of the top 5 breakfasts in town. Today the weather is awesome so the patio is perfect.
The location was nice...I had a hard time finding something I would like. And after I got home I got sick-food poisoning.

Not that impressed at all.  The food and drinks were way over priced and the service inside was so bad.  We had to ask for water 3x, food took forever to get and it just seemed like our group of 7 was an inconvenience.  We got there early and had drinks outside, which was lovely, but we were told all the tables outside were reserved so we only had a short time to sit and enjoy until we had to move.  I would have rather gone across the street to the City Grill.

Oh Richardson's...you never cease to impress  me. I was there tonight for my mother's birthday with my brother, sister in law, niece & nephew & surprisingly enough, it was pretty dead. This was the first time I've been to the new location (hadn't been to the previous location in at least a year) and even though some lady came in & said "OH it's so different but so similar"..(doesn't make a whole lot of sense)...it looks pretty much identical to the previous location...cozy seating & all..pretty sure there's extra seating on the side as well.   The hostess was nice & sat us as soon as our full party was there. We started off with the chips & guac which was pretty fantastic (spicy as well but I love a good kick to my food) & the pinot noir which is fabulous...best pinot I've had in a while.   We then proceed to split the blackened salmon with pineapple salsa (my mother & I) with the mixed veggies & potato stuffed green chile & two side salads....two side salads were definitely not required...they're huge as are the portions typically served at Richardson's. It was delicious.  I'm not sure where previous Yelpers have noted they only have one dessert as we had not only the flan but the sopapillas as well which were prepared perfectly...not too doughy, not too tough. Absolutely great end to the meal.   Overall, great experience. The server was extremely patient with us as we requested things frequently & was laid back while being attentive at the same time.   If ya haven't been, go. It's a great atmosphere for a date & I can't wait to go back once the weather's cooled off to enjoy the patio.

Went to Richardson's this morning for brunch with friends.  Sat on the patio, that was nice.  We ordered the drink specials, $5 mimosas and $5 bloody Mary's. I enjoyed my Mimosa a great deal.  For brunch, I ordered the Crab Cakes Benedict that I thought was rich and delicious.  Would have loved a piece or two of fruit to help cut the richness but it's a minor complaint.  I would definitely order this again and return for Brunch.  My partner had the Adovado Benedict and that was also delicious.  The service was pleasant.  We will definitely be back.

My review is of the service, not of the food. I live very close to there, and the service staff has never seemed like they care about their jobs. I'm glad I go for the flavor of the food, and not to be catered to, but it kind of ruins the atmosphere of a BEAUTIFUL restaurant if the servers don't care about their patrons.

This is NOT a review about the restaurant!!!  This is an internet complaint about one of the servers, Jr.  He's incredibly rude!  He wasn't personable one bit and came off as snappy.  He was demeaning every time he spoke.  This is our absolute FAVORITE place to eat and I can't believe that my experience didn't meet my expectations ONLY because of this server.   Obviously I will continue to return because the food is amazing, but I hope I won't be seeing such rude employees at the best restaurant in Phoenix.

OH, RICHARDSONS!!!  You broke my heart!  After 2 wonderful, memorable "home-run"  experiences in the past, I bring my family to share good times and brag on you...and YOU LET ME DOWN...BADLY!!    Before arriving in Phoenix this weekend,   I learned though that the old Richardsons burned down but another "sister" restaurant "Rokerij" was serving the Richardsons menu.  I thought that's cool!  I am sorry to say that this time, it was a MAJOR FUMBLE.  I don't think a restaurant has ever disappointed me like Richardsons or Rokerij (or whatever they call themselves".    I ordered one of their blackboard special entrees of the day:  Sea bass encrusted in pine-nuts.  The waitress told me I could have either mashed potatoe baked in a half of a jalapeno, or I could have plain mash potatoes.  I chose the plain mash potatoes since I cannot eat jalapeno.  My husband (who is trying to go vegan) ordered the calamari entree salad.    My son ordered the pastole soup and a BBQ chicken pizza.  Past 2 experiences at Richardsons:  we were always served chips and salsa when we sat down.   This time:  no chips and salsa.   So, we ordered some.  we didn't get it for 15 to 20 minutes.  (And they charged us.)  My son was served his Pastole soup at the same time as the pizza, not ahead of the pizza.  That was odd.  Then when he started eating the pizza, it was not the pizza he ordered.  It was a plain feta cheese pizza, not BBQ chicken.  My husband's salad tasted bitter...my husband said he thought the lettuce did not taste fresh.    As for MY entree, it was served about 10 minutes AFTER my family received their food.  AWKWARD!!  My son and husband didn't feel comfortable eating their dinner when I sat there with nothing (except chips).  When my entree finally arrived, it had the wrong potato...the one I didn't order...the one with the jalapeno green pepper...not the plain mashed potato.  Also, the pine-nut encrusted sea bass didn't look like it had any pine-nuts.  I wouldn't have ever guessed that there was a shred of pine nut associated with that fish.  So, I inquired and was told that just because it said it was encrusted with pine nuts doesn't mean that it would be covered with pine-nuts...it was supposed to be a "dusting".    It was clear by this time,. we were having major problems with our dining experience.  I thought, this can't be the same Richardsons I remembered from the past.    The waitress was "busy" and my husband went in search of the manager at the front of the restaurant.  He was in the middle of explaining the problem to the manager when the phone rang...the manager told my husband he had to take the call and my husband was just left standing there.   (Oh, really??
