You interrupt a customer standing in front of you telling you about a service issue to take a phone call?)  My husband is a good sport and he waited and then continued to expalin the problem.    Some minutes later, the manager appeared at our table with the plain mashed potatoes.  As he served me the potatoes, he blurted out that "I wasn't really supposed to get a choice of potato in the first place, since I was ordering off the Richardsons menu".  (Recall the waitress gave me the option...I didn't ask for the option.  I didn't know what menu I was ordering off of...how am I supposed to know?) Is the manager actually telling  the customer that she shouldn't have gotten what they offered.  (OH REALLY??)  My husband explained then that the waitress had offered it.  Reply:  "She wasn't supposed to."  (OH, DEAR! WHAT'S A CUSTOMER SUPPOSED TO DO!)    So, in summary:  most of what COULD  have gone wrong at Richardsons DID: 1)  Chips and salsa (I guess not offered to patrons complimentary anymore).   We requested them and were charged the $5...alright, I can pay for the chips.  It's just odd they don't offfer this anymore.  AND why did it take 20 minutes to get chips and salsa?? 2)  My husband's salad did not taste fresh.  Poor guy...he had his hands full trying to voice his concern to the manager about my meal and my son's and his wasn't right either! 3)  My son's pizza:  they served him the wrong one.  Shouldn't the waitress be checking the order for accuracy before serving it?? 4) My son's soup wasn't served before the pizza.  So he has pizza and soup served at the same time.  Maybe the waitress could have asked if he wanted the soup before or with the pizza.  We thought it would come before.  (ASSUME NOTHING AT THIS PLACE!) 5)  My mashed potato:  offered an option, served the option I didn't pick, then told by the manager that i shouldn't have had the option in the first place.  (JEESH!)   By the way, the table next to us also had terrible service.  We overheard the waitress ask the patrons when they were asking for their check, "Did you ever get the beer you ordered?"  (DOESN'T SHE EVEN KNOW??)    As stated before, I have experienced much better at Richardsons previously.  They should be embarrassed!!!!
Amazing Sunday breakfast w/fam and this is all due to our amazing  server Rick! Thanks Rick!!! Food, drinks, experience.
The food is nothing short of spectacular! Must try the carne adovada! Go hungry. Portions are enormous. Adam is a wonderful bartender and always takes good care of us when we come in.
Hotel California dining.  This restaurant is a unique gem with great food.

Breakfast Nirvana.  One of the best places for New Mexican style breakfasts. If you like pork with your eggs this is the place. Carne Adovada Benedict a real treat. Great interior and friendly knowledgable staff.

Took the family there for my anniversary. This was a recommendation from a co worker. The parking is complimentary which is a good thing as it is coupled with another restaurant and they seem to be land locked. The restaurant has a cozy feel about it with a mixture of bar, booth, or patio seating. The Mrs. and I both had top shelf margaritas and we were not the least bit disappointed. We then moved to some of the best calimari I have ever had. On to the main course. Our top sirloin steak was cooked perfectly and had great flavor with the portables mushroom and seasonings. My wife got the Brussels sprouts with her steak. I hate Brussels sprouts with a passion, but WOW we're these good. I had the corn which was excellent. The green Chile potato was excellent. My son had the sea food pasta which he said was very good. The shrimp and scallops were nothing to laugh at, they were yuge! Desert was a chocolate cake served with chocolate sauce and raspberries and blue berries. Yummmy!   Well, that's was out 26th Anniversary, and I am glad we spent it in such a quality restaurant. Next time I'll have some fish or Mexican food. They have a nice variety but don't overwhelm you with to many choices. Price was adequate for the quality of food. But I'm the guy that will spend $100 on a steak, if it's a $100 steak. Highly recommend reservations!

I had lunch here yesterday with friends and it was just OK.  I was disappointed because I love Mexican food, but can't eat hot spicy. It is recommended that you ask for a 'sample' before ordering a dish and I did so. The sauces had a lot of flavor, but were just too hot for me. I asked the waitress what she would recommend on the menu that was more suited to my taste buds. She said there was nothing but perhaps a pasta dish or hamburger. So, my friends got huge, beautiful, aromatic dishes of steaming food and I got a plain hamburger with skinny, cold fries. I was so disappointed. I'm not sure why restaurants only cater to clients who can add heat to their dishes with hotter sauces, but leave others wanting.  My friends loved their food and kept raving about them. So, if that is what you like, super, but don't invite your friends that you know can't enjoy it.   As if that wasn't bad enough, on the way out, we passed the patio area and there was a couple with their dog sitting next to the man in the booth, eating off the table!  This was NOT a service dog, it was a spoiled pet and it was disgusting to watch. I personally don't want to sit on a cushion where a dog has been licking tidbits off the seat and I certainly don't want to see a dog eating off a plate on the table. People are abusing their privileges of being allowed to take their pets onto the patio. I'm wondering what the health department would have to say if they witnessed such a thing. Yes, I complained and the employee placated me by saying he 'understood' and that things were 'sterilized' after dogs leave, but he didn't do anything about asking the people to put their dog on the floor!   There are tens of thousands of wonderful restaurants in Phoenix competing for my business. I don't think Richardson's will be on my list again anytime in the future.

Food was delicious as expected but the atmosphere at dick's is more my style. If you like New Mexico hatch chill cuisine, you can't go wrong with Richardson's. Big portions and always piping hot out of the kitchen.

Went for brunch yesterday and ordered the CARNE ADOVADA BENEDICT(twopoachedeggsonEnglishmuffinswithcarneadovada,jalapeno hollandaise, beans & your choice of potatoes or hash browns)And it was Delicious!!!!!! My friend and I also had 2 very good mimosas- I will definitely be back!
We LOVE this place. Food is consistently on point. The staff is super friendly and they make a mean jalapeño margarita. Keep up the good work Richardson's!
The Carne adovada never fails in its deliciousness.  Richardsons is a definite "go to" place when we are in Phoenix.

I was suggested this place by a friend who recently had a date there. I made reservations for a Friday night and was very excited since she highly recommended it. I was happy to find that there was valet service considering parking was limited. We were not sat right away but I wasn't too worried about it. Our service was great. The server was not overwhelming and very informative. I am a steak guru and decided to order the surf and turf dish with steak. I ordered it rare and it was prepared perfectly. I was AMAZED on the quality of beef that was used. I'm very apprehensive to places that serve steak considering its basic USDA choice, not prime. However, I was pleasantly surprised and pleased. I love this place and have no been back, but plan to go back soon!  I also REALLY liked the wood burning smell in the restaurant. Was definitely a welcoming smell.

Lovely dinner.  The staff is cordial, the ambiance is warm, the smell coming out of the exhaust fans outside is heavenly.  I came on a night when I wasn't feeling well and still forced myself to eat.  Wasn't a fan of the bar element as I'm more into intimate, quiet dining, but would still gladly come back.  Good New Mexican isn't that easy to find outside of NM.

Deliciousness - 3.5/5 Happiness - 2.5/5  Richardson's is fine, but I don't think it is worth the price. The building itself is very unique and I have always enjoyed my time most when sitting in the outside lobby during happy hour. The restaurant itself is very cramped and very dim. You can hear every conversation and there simply is a lack of space. Water pitchers were constantly placed on the booth where my wife was sitting, meaning she kept looking over her shoulder to make sure they weren't dropped on her head. In my experiences, the servers never seem too engaged either. You get a bottle of water to fill yourself and rarely ever see the waiter post-order. On my recent trip, we got the wrong tab handed to us and it took us about 15 minutes to flag down the waiter to redress the issue.  The menu is relatively limited but full of unique offerings. My favorite is the pasta heidi - green chili linguine in a chipotle sauce. Very delicious. Their double baked green chili potato is also unique to Richardson's and quite delicious. I have also enjoyed their steak and fish offerings. But there are also plenty of just fine, nothing special options. That includes the Santa fe Chicken and their pizzas.   My biggest complaint is though the food is good, it simply isn't worth the price (mid $20s to mid $40s). A lot of the appetizers are the same price as the entrees, and I simply don't think the food justifies the prices.  It's a fun location, and the food is good. I simply have never felt compelled to make this a top option when I go out to eat.

We were here years ago (actually Dicks Hideway) and loved the tamales so dropped in when we drove by. We had our kid with us and didn't think that would be an issue, but felt the cold shoulder when we walked in. We felt unwelcome, and the hostess seemed to have an attitude. No one smiled, once. At all. When we were taken to the table, the hostess just stared at the server and we stood there uncomfortably in silence for an oddly long period of time. We weren't offered the specials and had to ask about tamales, which were a special.  We were talking about how we felt like our presence was an inconvenience and I think someone overheard, because then the waitress started being nicer. The food wasn't as good as we remembered and the experience was miserable and we won't be coming back.
Small bathrooms  Small TVs  No food happy hour?!!

Richardson's was recommended to us for brunch while we were visiting Arizona for Spring Training. I'll state right now that I have a thing against restaurants that pretend to be something that they are not. Richardson's came off as very pretentious. I do not understand why they have valet parking when there is plenty of parking to go around. On top of that, the host actually asked us if we had a reservation when there were plenty of open tables and when we replied that we didn't, the host made it seem like he was doing us a favor by giving us a table. It would have been better had the service improved as our meal progressed but it actually got worse. It took forever to get our food. In fact, it took so long that the server apologized multiple times and offered my husband a free iced tea.   We ordered the Huevos Rancheros (three eggs, blue corn tortillas, red or green chile & cheese, potatoes or hash browns, beans & a tortilla) and the Carne Adovada & Eggs ( three eggs, smoked pork simmered in red chile, potatoes or hash browns, beans & a tortilla). Apparently their main seller is the Adovada. I did not care for it at all because it was smoked too heavily. But this is just a personal preference. My husband liked it and loved the generous portion size. He could barely get through it actually which was surprising since he's a pretty big eater. I liked my Huevos Rancheros for the most part but it was just so expensive for what it was. I added some ham to go with my eggs but the dish just felt way to heavy for me and I didn't enjoy it enough to finish it. With that said, I definitely preferred the green chile sauce over the red so please order the green sauce if you get the chance. Oh and Richardson's? Stop skimping people on the tortillas. For the amount of food that was served, you can definitely serve more than one tortilla.   I'm not sure that I can recommend Richardson's. I mean it wasn't bad in any shape or form but it also wasn't anything that justified the price we paid for brunch. It was just too expensive even though I'm sure everything is high quality and such. And that valet. Unnecessary. Plus, living in California means that I'm exposed to some fantastic Mexican cuisine and Richardson's did not blow my mind. A pass for me! 3/5

Amazingly good food. Great cocktails. Ate dinner and brunch here. Rachel was our brunch bartender, really attentive, very charming. Great bartender. I will miss this place. Highly recommended. Real deal cuisine.

I go to Richardson's on every visit to Phoenix just for their Huevos Rancheros. It never disappoints!!  On my last visit, my cousin ordered Eggs Benedict Jalapeño with a jalapeño hollandaise that was wonderfully flavorful without the heat. I loved it so much that I put some of her hollandaise on my food!  I've only eaten breakfast here, but I highly recommend it!

Unfortunately, the drastically mixed reviews are are accurate- although unless the really good ones are purely nostalgic, I'm not sure where they are coming from.  I hadn't been t Richardson's since they'd rebuilt...remember when this spot was Timothy's??  Now, that...I miss!  Anyhow, our dinner for 8 went from bad- a bartender who had very good wine knowledge but then just poured my drink into a new glass after I discovered a crack in it and gave us serious attitude when questioned about the need to remake the drink....to worse- spoiled seafood with major ammonia smell.  2 stars- one for the Manager who when we finally complained took care of us properly and one for the cozy patio.  Just not sure if I can bring myself to give them another try... Sad.

I returned with a group but didn't tell them about my prior review.  Here's my second experience...better than last time but still a food timing issues.  The better part.  I ordered the egg breakfast.  Everything on the plate was great and there was so much I took left overs home which were good reheated later.  The star was the bacon.  The best bacon I've ever eaten in my life.  The valet parkers were speedy and organized.  It's an amazing place to people watch.  Here's the area they still struggle with - speed from food order to table. So the key is just enjoy another beverage and cherish the extra conversation time.

The flavor and amount of food is unparalleled to any Mexican food place out there. I guess that's it... it's not just Mexican, it's NEW Mexican cuisine; It's wonderful! Great atmosphere and they have drink and appetizer specials after 9pm. I've visited about 5 to 7 times ( mostly dinner, a few late nights, and once for brunch) and each time, the food is outstanding. Some dishes are spicy. It can be pricey but it's so worth it, plus the portions are huge. You will not be disappointed,  there's a reason people drive from all over the valley to come here. Now, EAT!

WARNING, do not sit on the patio. During this wonderful weather, you may be tempted to bask in the outdoors while you leisurely indulge in a mimosa or bloody mary. This restaurant is not the place to do so. For two weekends in a row I have sat on the patio only to be sorely neglected. I waited for 20 minutes to get a drink each time I sat down. This was because I discovered that the bartender outside is also the waitress for the entire patio. She is heavily bogged down and cannot accommodate patrons sitting at the tables. There were 5 of us, all four adults got their meal and were done eating when the 5th persons food finally arrived. I have no complaints about the food, but I also have no desire to give money to a place that has great food but crappy service.
Had the Carne Adovada and was more than impressed!  Going back for some of the pricier dishes because they sound fantatsic.

Great atmosphere, friendly service, but the food was just okay for me-- some dishes were definitely better than others. I ordered the sriracha chicken and my bf ordered the porckhop. I didnt think the chicken was very good at all, i much preferred his pork chop-- the flavors and texture had way more depth. On the bright side, drinks were strong and the waitress came around a lot.

The food was wonderful, but the service at the bar was TERRIBLE. I MEAN THE WORST EVER. The bartender got my first drink and never came back to ask if I wanted another one. Then he looked and saw me with my card in my hand and ignored me. It took 10 minutes for him to bring me my check I felt like I had been taken hostage. The food was great but I'd never come back due to the poor service.

Fantastic. Had a table of 12 on the patio and it was a beautiful experience. Food was delicious and fresh. Very authentic. Service was perfect. Could not have been better. The ambience of this place including the Rookery was all we could have hoped for a casual yet elegant evening. A must go-to place when in Phoenix. It is a special place.

Came here to find out if this place knows how to make authentic New Mexican food. I grew up eating Carne adovoda and green chile stew. I was feeling home sick and this place definitely hit the spot. The stew was wonderful and the Carne adovoda was pretty good. Turns out they know what they are doing when it comes to New Mexican food. Some of the items on the menu are New Mexican food with a twist, I can't wait to find out how everything else tastes.

Tell me why you dont have high-chairs! Had a reservation here this evening. My husband said three and a toddler. Showed up, my 17 month old started crawling on the table- had to leave, unfortunately. The menu looks phenomenal, the vibe was poppin for  a sunday night, so sad we had to miss out. Until next time- highchairs please!!

Where do I start. Made a reservation for my wife's birthday and took my family. We told them we had 6 adults plus a baby. When we arrived a young man led us out to the patio and showed us to our seats. The atmosphere was nice but the table was so low it would have been hard to eat so we asked for another location. They had another outdoor table that was normal height and would work for our party.  They said they had a reservation for that already. Why not place the people that weren't there yet at the lower tables. They took us inside and sat us in a corner booth. The noise level was loud. We waited for the rest of my kids got there and we waited and waited for drinks. We then waited quite awhile for our food. Longer than is the normal time to expect. Even though we mentioned we had an infant they had no booster seats or high chairs.  Not even one. Our waiter said it has been mentioned before but no change. The booth sat in the corner and it was overly hot. As we were finishing our dinner and about to pay the air conditioner was turned on. So over all the service was mediocre. The food was hit and miss from dish to dish as some were good and some were not so. After paying the almost 300 dollar bill we oft and decided we wouldn't be back. Richardsons needs to listen more to their clientele on ways to make things better for all their customers. I DONT recommend this resturant for a lot of reasons.

This place is absolutely terrible. If your waitress's name is Misty I suggest you ask to be reseated. She's rude, demeaning, and VERY inexperienced. It'll take you 30 minutes just to grab her attention to place your order.  The food was nothing to die for, and you have to ask for refills. I really wish our experience was better as the reviews below suggest its a decent place, but we will not be back. For the money you spend here you can get a great meal with EXCELLENT service down the road. Usually if the food was not to par but service was good we return for a second try- as every kitchen has an off day. But Misty sealed the deal for us. Management needs to rethink that one.

I absolutely love this place. I have been coming here for years. Now it's Tuesday tradition to come and drink and eat some amazing food. Tony and Eddie are epic. They never let my drink go dry and we have the best conversation. I have never eaten something here that I didn't love. I can't survive my crazy week without Richardson's!

Wonderful eggs Benedict with jalapeño hollandaise, with green chicken enchiladas! Susana out server was very attentive and enthusiastic the entire time, such a great southwest brunch location in Phoenix.

I really liked the ambiance here. I went here for a business dinner and it was a nice, relaxed atmosphere. I'm always happy to find a spot that serves good mole, and this fits the bill. My boss was also raving about their Moscow mules. Nice work, Richardson's.

Make sure you come hungry, the portions are very large. Also make sure you can handle spice, as the chile packs a punch, much like you would find in New Mexico. The only drawback was that the service was a little slow. Still, it's authentic New Mexico-style food, and it's delicious too.

Wonderful what a treat , just found it on yelp after we flew in and boy were we blown away . My husband had the pork it was so well seasoned with out sauces , wow thank goodness he shared , my daughter and I both ordered the chicken which was wrapped around spinach and cheese also very good , we could not eat everything such big portions you might want to share . We were staying at a hotel without a refrigerator so we couldn't take left overs . This is the place I will send people to and come back to every time I am in town

Let me get the negative out first, the lighting!  It makes me almost sick and takes a while to get used to, really dark purple colored lights, yuk!  The food is really good (try the garlic plate if your not on a 1st date).  Prices are a little high but not out of touch.  Would be a great place for a date.  Make reservations, it gets busy, hence service can be less than spectacular.

I was visiting Scottsdale on business and one of my colleagues suggested this place. We came here for dinner and the food was very good although a bit pricier in comparison to the portion size. A glass of wine can cost $15 and above.  We ordered the skewers for appz which were really very good - the flavours and char on the meat and veggies! My entree was the top sirloin which was great too!
Absolutely one of my favorite restaurants in Phoenix! Always have gracious servers and an amazing crowd. The best is the food, always consistent and always great tasting!!!

This place is the go to place for me and my husband.  We go here for anniversaries.  We take out of towners here.  This is one of my favorite restaurants!!  I love this type of food.  I am from NM and the green chile's are right on!  The food here is down right amazing.
We loved Richardson's! Great date night restaurant. The food was fabulous and our server, Jason, was amazing! Best service we've gotten anywhere in awhile!

Far fancier in style and atmosphere than I had expected from the menu or the, quite reasonable, prices.  There's a valet and everything, and it gets insanely crowded.  At 5 pm I was told there was only one table for 3 before 9 pm, and they don't take reservations for groups that small.  Fortunately we got served, and the food was entirely decent, but nothing to rave for.  I had a tamale plate, the main course of which was larger and less brick-like than most of the tamales I've actually had in New Mexico.
Portions were huge!  We ate it all though.  That must have meant the food was tasty.  My wife and I shared one dish, The New Mexican Platter.  We also enjoyed the prickly pear margarita.

Seriously overrated! We have been to Richardson's once before and had a pleasant experience. This time around was completely different and have to say will not ever be back. A 2 hour 10 minute disaster! First server warned us of the 16 min garlic platter which was fine, we were excited to try it. Didn't realize she also waited to put our order in until after we ate it. With 11 people on the patio (4 kiddos) at 108 degrees with misters they turned off on us after sitting down for 10 mins...it's a no brainier to grab the manager for an explanation. Well, that didn't happen because the mgr left for the Dicks last Resort location??? It is Friday night, is it not??? So the kitchen lost our ticket was the explanation and when the mgr showed his face he decided to give us a 12% discount on our evening. Sorry, not good enough! Too many other great choices in the area to go back again. Blahhhh!!!! Server was sweet...not her fault...just inadequate management!

We like the food here because they always have a special seafood and meat menu. We did a trio fish with special request for grilled asparagus and cauliflower. The cauliflower did not look pretty but was really good, had a nice charred flavor.

This place is amazing.   How does a restaurant top rated on Zag ats and Thril list not get top billing on Yelp?  No idea! I was blown away by the quality, service, and atmosphere.   Authentic Southwestern cuisine at it's finest.  You won't regret coming here.

Great owner and staff. Waiter was wonderful took the time to explain 'the numerous' specials. He knocked it out of the  park and recommended the Carne Adovada (one of their classics). Smoked pork simmered in green chile.  It was delicious, the best Mexican I have had in a very long time. Oh, and they have great drinks too. I will be back!

We have been going to Richardson's for years, even before the fire. We were looking forward to the reopening. Have been there several times since but last night's experience was horrible. Service was poor, wouldn't re-cork wine we bought, food marginal, seemed to be understaffed. Manager said they went through a "major house cleaning a month ago and new staff are not all trained."  So we wasted $80 for 2 people to train their staff?  Manager offered apology and suggested we come back in a couple of months.  FAT CHANCE!!

Place is bomb dot com Must visit when in Phoenix In my top five joints   Long before Yelp or the Travel Channel, my go to source for finding the best places to check out when travelling was a book called "Eat Your Way Across the USA."  I think this was only one of two places in Arizona that the book featured.  Went to Richardson's for the first time in probably the late 90's or early 2000's and have been hooked ever since.  It is among my absolute most favorite restaurants.  A couple years back, the original location was destroyed by fire.  This was my first time in the new location which is right around the corner from the original spot.  The interior looks almost exactly like the old location.  They now have mandatory valet, though, which I am not crazy about.  In the past, I have gotten the huevos rancheros and the enchiladas.  Best I have ever had for both.  Today, I got the Trio which was Swordfish, Salmon and Mahi Mahi.  Came on a tortilla with asparagus and carrots.  Outstanding!  They have five dollar mimosas, bellinis, and bloody marys during brunch hours.  Had one mimosa and one bellini.  I wish I had just come to Richardson's straight from the airport when I arrived last Tuesday.  It is that freaking good!

Dark lit, copper top bar (I think, it was dark), booze flowing and amazing comfort food makes this place a nice place for Tommy to go! Yeah, third person, so 1990's! Belly up here and get special happy hour prices on drinks and food! I usually stay clear of New Mexican food, but I have been here a couple times now and the flavors are amazing. Green chili, roasted peppers, garlic, smoked meats, fish, oysters, you name it, it's all amped up here. The heat of spice here isn't bad like most New Mexican food so don't be afraid and eliminate choices. Now I know some people aren't fans of the darker atmosphere here, but let your eyes acclimate and you'll see the warm inviting dinning room. Just be sure you don't drop your keys or wallet! JK. This place also has a great outdoor dinning and bar area in between the restaurants. Nice little patio to grab drinks and visit!

Still a five - without a doubt!!  We went here with another couple who are good friends.  They had never been to Richardson's before and so we were a little uneasy about whether they would like it as much as we do.  We arrived at 5:20 without reservations because for some reason I thought they didn't take reservations for under eight which they indeed do.  They take reservations for 4 and over.  Anyway, they seated us immediately but explained that our table had been reserved for 6:45 and would that work for us.  Yes, indeedy!!  Nabbed a great corner cozy booth!  One of the best in the house!!  As soon as we sat down we were served big glasses of ice water with lemon and asked if we wanted chips and salsa.  We had never ordered them before and they were really good.  They came warm, with a very flavorful guacamole, a salsa which tasted really great but was a little too warm for me and a couple other dips which I didn't try because I thought they'd be warmer than the salsa.   We ordered drinks - one Reisling, two house Margaritas and one Rob Roy on the Rocks.  Everyone was pleased with their libations!  Onto our dinner orders!   Two of us ordered the grilled shrimp pasta which was amazing!  I can't begin to guess how many calories were in that dish but it was so worth every bite and we both brought some home.  Our companions ordered two of their chicken items and were very pleased!    Our waiter was wonderful!  He was knowledgeable about the menu and spent time with us describing the various dishes.    They also have specials every night written on a chalkboard.  Lots of great sounding stuff, but oh my, that shrimp pasta was - ooh la la!  Will I be back?  Without a doubt if my chapter three in life lasts awhile longer!

I'm amazed that I haven't posted a review, after years upon years of patronage to both this new and old location. I always describe as upscale New Mexican with large portions.  Green or red? I love green, but sometimes I go for both.  My favorites: + smoked turkey enchiladas + Green Chile stew + breakfast tacos + can you say specials? Fresh fish specials served daily + GCP: Green Chile Potato + Pasta Heidi (Green Chile pasta linguine) + stuffed Anaheim peppers   Location: side by side to Rokerij- I check our both for whom has the better seating. Pro tip: you can usually order the same menu at both.  Decor: who doesn't love the custom hammered copper bars?  Weekends: if you have a group, make a reservation or your wait will be long.  Only thing I have ever disliked on their menu is the House salad: which I avoid.

My favorite out to dinner place in PHX.  Service is spectacular, CJ in the outside bar is funny as Hell, and Jamie, well she's very friendly, and quite a looker.  Oh, the food by the way is outstanding.  Try the enchiladas, pork chop, and my favorite, the pasta Heidi.  If you only have one place to eat in PHX, this is it.

I only come here for breakfast/ brunch and I only order one thing the Eggs Benedict Jalapeno. I've had most of their breakfast and lunch items but every time I order something else I regret it. As a younger man I had them the first time I was there and it was love at first taste. I came back as frequently as I could trying everything I could on their menu. As I have aged Richardson's has taught me that I don't need to be so damn adventurous. I mean I had to honestly ask myself do I really need all of the heart racing excitement of ordering the unknown, wondering if it is going to be any good. The honest answer here is when you find the perfect breakfast item at a place just roll with it. Richardson's Eggs Benedict Jalapeno is my breakfast soul-mate.

I loved the decor.  Missed happy hour but had a marvelous drink called the Hemingway.  Food was expensive, good but not exceptional.  They smoke their own pork.  I put my clothes outside when I got home because they reeked!

Where do I start? I'm from New Mexico, northern New Mexico, and I am picky about places claiming to serve our amazing cuisine, but clearly the Richardson's restaurants know their stuff.  Oh my goodness: I ordered the breakfast burrito with bacon, potatoes, Christmas (red and green chile together) and my mouth was in chile heaven. Wait. How did I forget? Sunday is happy hour ALL DAY until 6pm. My fiancé ordered the rellenos and eggs and his steamy plate came out covered in chile and cheese goodness. Truly, this is a diamond in the rough.   Our food came out piping hot, the only way to eat a fantastic meal, and our drinks were fantastic.  This place is beautiful! We sat at the outdoor bar, enjoying the beautiful weather, company, and ambiance. You can smell the wood oven and watch pizza and drinks being made right in front of you. The outdoor patio seating looks amazing and we'll definitely be back. Most definitely.   Do not skip this amazing place. It's wonderful and then some!

Went for lunch (same menu as dinner so a bit pricey) and enjoyed the Chimayo Chicken which is a stuffed chicken breast with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes, poblano chiles and asiago. Not much stuffing and the cheese was all oozed-out but it was tasty with some nice vege's and a great house salad. Probably wouldn't get again. My guest had the Richardson's combo which was more of a brunch item - two chicken enchiladas (outstanding) and a jalapeno benedict (great ham and hollandaise - light) and a mess of tasty asparagus - would highly suggest this dish. The heat level on everything was a bit light but we had not specified more. That was a bit disappointing.

I just want to preface this by saying I LOVE to go out to eat.  And I am not picky and NOT hard to please.  But last night's dinner was one of the top 3 worst dinning experiences of my life.  I don't think the night could of possibly gone worse.  We walked in and were completely ignored.  Servers acted like we were in the way (there was no where to go - didnt they just remodel?  Couldnt they fix that?). And the restaurant was practically empty.  Finally someone came up to us and asked to help us.  I told them we had a reservation and they started to walk us to a table.  The aisle is only one person wide and he walked us to a table full of people.  He said "oops, that was wrong, I guess we are going over there..." so we all had to turn around and shimmy down the aisle to the OTHER side of the restaurant.  We were sat in a booth for a few moments when we were approached by an employee who told us we couldnt sit there and the person who sat us "was just a busser."  Um, WTF?  So we are moved to a 1/2 booth/table.  Finally sat, a server immediately approaches us and asked if we would like something to drink or an appetizer.  Um, just sat down, super annoyed, can i get a minute to recover please?    And this server then proceeded to suck my will to live the rest of the night.  More on that later, though.  It is ridiculously dark in the restaurant.  Like, cannot see jack dark.  And the pillows in the booths kind of gross me out...like sleeping in a stranger's bed with dirty sheets.  And bottom line, the food isnt good enough to put up with price and the hassle of valet parking.  My mother in laws steak was well done when she ordered it medium.  My "stuffed" pork chop didnt appear to have anything in it.  But again, it was so dark I could of been eating a bear for all I know.  Back to the server.  She would take our order, not write it down and come back FIVE MINUTES LATER and double check with us what we ordered.  And her guess was wrong!  She did it with the drink order AND the food order.  So I guess it makes sense the steak was incorrectly cooked...  End of drinner, we just want to get the hell out...server takes the bill and credit card, brings it back with no receipt to sign.  And of course never comes back.  We had to hunt someone down and he brought us back the recipt to sign.  Sigh.  At the very end of the night, we then get stuck waiting in a line for the valet.  Some lady butted in front at the line.  Unfortunately for her, she got the brunt of my frustrations.  Poor gal was probably just as scarred by her shitty dinning experience.

The bartender was going off on the ladies next to us who returned a dish because it had no turkey in it.  When returned to the kitchen the 3 Mexican  guys in the kitchen were totally talking BS about the customers. In Spanish.  Unprofessional and bad. This place is seriously lacking management and the staff all seemed miserable.

If you are looking for New Mexican food you might as well drive 6 hours to Albuquerque. The food here is mediocre and the red chile tasted burnt. It tastes like the red chile has been made by red chile powder and way too thick. I had 5 people with me. All pro's on NM food. No sopapilla's at all. On a positive note the green chile pasta was pretty good even if the chicken that came with it was dry. The food was heated on the plate and half of the chile was stuck/burnt to the plate.

My son and his fiance brought us and a friend here Saturday night for dinner. We had a reservation but arrived an hour early to sit at the bar for a drink. The hostess was pleasant (with beautiful light lilac colored hair) and said she could get us a table early, which she did within 20 minutes.   Our server was prompt, knowledgeable and very helpful. I am a vegetarian so I read menus whenever possible before my first visit to a restaurant. I knew going into this place that there wasn't a selection for vegetarians, but I held out hope that the there were sides not listed on the menu that I could have them put together for me, which they did.   We ordered appetizers - the roasted garlic plate was delicious! I didn't try the other appetizer plate that was primarily dead stuff, but everyone else said it was wonderful. For dinner I tasted one of their potato stuffed chilies and that was very tasty; I also had sauteed vegetables, rice and beans. I presume the rice was cooked on broth, but I didn't ask. The beans were really good, but very salty. Most restaurants salt the heck out of their beans, though, so I won't deduct for that. I turned my plate of food into 3 meals!   Everyone else at the table loved their entrees. They said their meat/seafood was cooked perfectly with the right amount of sauce/seasoning.   I must commend our server again, he was a young guy who couldn't have been more accommodating. I read reviews where service was the biggest issue for other customers. Fortunately, that was not our experience.   We will definitely eat here again.    Pros: Unique Ambiance - great place to bring a date Service Accommodating  Food was fresh, hot, good flavor Valet parking Charming/cozy patio seating Intimate indoor setting Wine selection   Cons: Very little vegetarian faire  Valet parking the only parking option A little on the pricey side

I have been here a few times over the years.  Similar to the other two places owned by the same people.  Unfortunately they have the Valet parking for no apparent good reason.  They just tend to be in the way, blocking the parking!  Anyway the food here us OK, I have never been blown away by this place so it has never been a regular of mine.  I first went here almost 20 years ago when it was down the street and remember being a little disappointed back then.  I went with my neighbor who raved about the place but he is from Iowa!  What do they know about Southwest cuisine?!  Like their other two restaurants they have a good atmosphere and friendly staff and their apps are usually better than the entrees and a better value, especially during happy hour.

I've been coming here since the original location on 16th & Bethany before it burnt down.  I recently moved across town and now I'm 5 minutes away so naturally I've been going about once a week.  One of the best places for brunch in the city.  The portions are huge, the food is very spicy, and love the low-light ambiance.

The ambiance to this place was nice, and can be perfect for a date spot. :)   I met up with a friend of mine. The hostess that lead me to my table, seem like she didn't like her job at all. I didn't get a grin or smile,nothing.  I ordered the vegetarian New Mexico enchiladas.  OHHH MYYYY GOOOODNESSSSSSS. Deliciousness to my mouth. :)))))))) the rice, beans to the enchiladas was perfect!!!! I almost killed that dish. And you know what else was perfect??  My  pomegranate  margarita. Yes.. very friendly drink :D   I'll definitely return again.

Very pricey dinner menu, but I couldn't get a simple salad with a vinegarette dressing. Drinks are over priced without any flair. The carne plate, supposed to be their signature dish had much room for improvement. I had high expectations for my first time at this place, but was definitely disappointed!

STAY AWAY - The food has an amazing flavor and the restaurants offers a unique atmosphere.  However, the restaurant is located in a terrible spot along the main road.  The parking situation is so limited with poor entry signage in fine print.  It can get one feeling very agitated and frustrated.  The valet staff was blasting cars out of the driveway and I would not want them parking my vehicle.  I can park my own vehicle but, there is not much place to park.  Once we got thru the obstacle course and made it into the compound things went more sour.  The hostess seemed excited to quote 45 minute wait at Richardson's and sent us over to check at Rokerij with a longer wait of an hour. Imagine that, all on a Tuesday night. It wasn't even a weekend. I know it says something for the food.  Although, it isn't that large of a place.   In any case, we all just left and went somewhere else.  As a result, I found a great taco shop with great service.  This isn't the first time I've been to Richardson's where I encountered this type of situation but, this is the first time I decided I should write about it.  I was not real pleased with the way the hostess and staff interacted.  Richardson's staff seem to think it is a privilege for me to eat at the establishment and give my business.  In any case, I left dissatisfied and very hungry.  Lets just say I would not go out of my way to recommed this place.  I would recommend Richardson's if you can make reservations and walk there or if you don't mind waiting an hour and half to be seated for dinner.  Perhaps some people are more lucky with better service.  If you are visiting there anyway, maybe try going early.  As I mentioned, the food is amazing but, the service experience might not be so great.  You might even get bad table service from a snotty server like I did on a previous visit a few months back. I gave Richardson's several months before I decided to return back and now this. Now, I'm really not in a hurry to return.  Well they probably won't miss the business anyway.  Did anyone else notice it took some other yelp reviewer people up to 11 years to return?  I wonder why?   If you read this and decide to visit anyway,  maybe you'll have better luck than I have.  If not,  don't say I did not warn you. Good Luck!

If you haven't been....it's a MUST!!  Unless you hate the freshest, highest quality ingredient or Southwest inspired menu, I promise YOU WILL LOVE it!  Everything from the food, bars (one inside one outside), the most friendly, knowledgeable and down to earth staff.....thus place has it.  They own Rokerij next door which is connected by the coolest outdoor patio and Rokerij has an awesome underground bar......dark, mysterious and fun.  Forgot to check in when I was there last week but I'd give the same review as Richardson's.
I considered myself a American patriot until Richardson's took their red, white & blue enchiladas off of the menu.  Now I don't know what to stand for anymore.

First time I went with my wife sat at the bar and had a great experience.  Bartender was very attentive and friendly.  Drinks were tasty. Bar was crowded too.  Food was on point had ceviche app and spilt the surf and turf,  they spilt it up with an extra green chile potato and was easily a 4-5 star experience. Btw we just told them we were sharing and they spilt it up nice.  Second time, had reservation for 6 for a birthday.  We arrived on time and had to wait 45 minutes for our table.  Host seemed confused and had no one to go for help.  Service was extremely slow food took forever and didn't all come out at once.  Server seemed very frustrated.  Food was off and seemed like there was a major lack of leadership in the front and back of the house.   It's a shame because the flavors are good and group liked the food.  We were in the place for 2.5 hours easily. They did comp an appetizer for the wait but someone in our party had complained. Some of the meals are $40+ you expect them to do a little better.  I will go back and hoping next time I can upgrade score.

My husband and I went for an early dinner here for our anniversary.  We are crazy about this place after just this one visit, Jason was our waiter and he absolutely makes your evening so great !  We sat inside, it was not smokey in there at all.  We arrived about 5pm, Jason said all the tables were reserved at 6:00 and 6:15, so he sat us in a nice booth but we needed to out by 6:15 ( good to know going in, right ! )  Speaking of reservations, you cannot make a reservation for 2 at all, must be 4 thats because they only have a few booths inside, large outside seating on their beautiful patio with fire pit. The food, I had the three enchiladas and you can pick what you want in each one.  My pick was one with green chili pork, one chicken and one cheese, comes with rice and beans and a large very tasty tortilla.  Most places the rice and beans are filler, but here they are so good, you will eat every bite.  The green chili pork was my favorite, the chicken was really good coming in second and the cheese which is usually my fav comes in third  My husband had the carne adovada rice and beans and tortilla.  He really enjoyed it, and the portions were to large that we had it again for lunch the next day. Appetizer you must try the queso with spinach and chorizo comes with blue and regular chips so tasty, so spicy good we ate every drop, the blue chips were the best. We tried the flan, it does have cream cheese in it so its not like regular flan, but its good too. Love, Love, Love this place, their food and Jason ! At dinner all parking is valet.
Beautiful dog friendly patio with cool air fans! Great place to take your furry friend for Sunday Funday!!

Excellent!  Love their garlic appetizer and they green chili stroganoff is my favorite.  My husband gets the enchiladas which are terrific, and it is always my dad's go to restaurant for his birthday...

My absolute favorite. Hands down! The food is AMAZING and consistent. Very important because I want to know that I every time I go I will have an amazing meal. That's how it is at Richardsons! Always perfect. The ambiance is chill, it's the perfect place to settle in and catch up with friends. Drinks are delicious. I always leave happy. Love it!

The husband and I came to Richardson's for happy hour to celebrate our 9 monthaversary (and we had a gift card, so that helped). We sat at the bar, the husband got a beer, I asked for a bellini (since it said they had them on special on their menu) and the bartender looked at me like I was insane... I guess they don't make those anymore? Not sure. I ended up getting a mimosa, which was very good. The OJ tasted fresh and the glass was a generous size. We had a feast of happy hour food items that included: Blackened scallops, chicken tostadas, chipotle ribs, green chili sliders, and a green chili potato. Some items were delicious and some were not so much. The scallops (HH priced at 15$, so still fairly expensive) were the best of the bunch in my opinion. They were perfectly cooked and came with 4 different sauces, beans, and rice... it was all delicious. I would come back and just get that. The portion size was very generous. The ribs were the second best item. They were very tender, fall off the bone, and flavorful. The green chili potato was ok, but really not as special as I would expect for a restaurant's signature item. It is essentially a twice baked potato, but instead of putting the potato innards back into the potato skin, they stuff it into a pepper.... I thought the pepper was too firm and the flavors didn't completely complement each other. The filling could have been seasoned better. The sliders were alright, they were like little french dips sort of with chilies on top. I didn't love them, they just weren't that flavorful or special. The worst dish of the night was the tostadas... they lacked flavor, fell apart, and just were boring. When a menu states that when you order chilies, you're responsible for the heat level, I expect something will be spicy... but nothing was. I liked this place alright overall, but it was a bit inconsistent. I would probably come back for happy hour, but it wouldn't be my first choice in town.

Richardson's along with its sister restaurants are staples in the neighborhood. Always great food with large portions. The service is always good. The servers seem to stay a long time so you see a lot of familiar faces which is nice. Another perk is they open early even during the week. As a early riser it's really nice to have a breakfast option other than IHOP.

A New Mexican restaurant in AZ? This made me think of my best friend who lives in NM. =)  I came here with a friend last night for dinner since she's been dying to come here. I think everything deserves a four star. I ordered the Pasta Hedi which was amazingly delicious! It's a pasta that comes with chicken on top of a tortilla. The sauce was sooooo yummy. I'm really into pasta so I really loved it. It also comes with a house salad which I thought was really good and very good size portion. I had to split it with my friend. We washed everything down with margaritas. I ordered the Prickly Pear margarita which definitely satisfied me after a long day..You have to try it!   The service was also very good. Our server always came back to make sure everything was to our liking. I loved the ambiance of the restaurant as well. It's a great date spot.  The only reason it doesn't get a four star from me is because it's a bit pricey. Between the both of us with our entrees and drinks the bill came out to about $60. That and it's pretty far from me. I wish there was one on my side of town. But you get what you pay for!   I'll definitely be coming back for that pasta and margarita again! Plus their brunch menu also looks beyond yummy and something that I'd like to try out. =)

Ok I'm updating my review because this place is by far my favorite restaurant in this area. The servers and bartenders are so nice and attentive! I felt like I needed to give them a shout out for their awesome work and for always making mine and my husband's dining experience here amazing hence why we continue coming back. I should try different items but we always end up getting the same thing every time. This place is great for brunch, lunch and dinner. For brunch I always get the enchiladas and eggs. I usually get the beef and cheese enchiladas and it's served w eggs and hash browns. It's HUGE so plan on taking a lot of it home w you... or share it. Also, you can choose from the dinner menu for brunch if you want... And my go to for dinner is the New Mexico Enchiladas (yes I luv enchiladas!!). I usually pick 2 beef and 1 shrimp or 1 chicken. The shredded beef inside the enchiladas are the best! And it comes w rice n beans but I opt out the beans for extra rice. And I always get the red and green sauce combo!! How can I choose btwn the 2?? My husband always gets the garlic shrimp pasta minus the avocado (he has an allergy to avocado! I kno so sad!!). This comes w a tri-colored rotelle pasta in a garlic cream sauce w jumbo shrimp which I always steal a couple from him! It's absolutely delicious!! Overall, I highly recommend this place!! Oh and if you want to watch sports, sit in the outdoor patio in front of the bar!

Go!  It is really good!  In from the Northeast and sat ouside (true sign of an out of towner in January).  Great space, great decor, and great servie.  Just really good and fresh tasting New Mexican food.  Had a Jalipo Mule and enjoyed it very much.  We both ordered off the specials board and were thrilled,  I ordered a "trio" while my guest ordered Lamb Taco's.   The flavors are amazing and with a great balance.  Guaranteed visit next time I'm back in Phoenix.
The atmosphere is classy and fun . Always love the food the spice can be a little hot. Pepsi served in bottles, no free refills. Brought my girls and thought it was not very kid friendly.

I came here just to get a prickly pear margarita.  All 3 were great!!   The food is covered in cheese and sauce, which is not the way I like my food, but I have to give the Manager Mario cudos, he patiently listened to our complaints and did not charge my friend for her dinner, which honestly she did not eat.  Please had a very nice outside seating area which would be great for a group of friends to enjoy some drinks and appetizers

I am such a huge fan of southwestern food and this place does the trick. Be careful that the food can be pretty spicy as a whole. The ambience is very chill and dark, like a lodge.   My fave dishes are the bacon wrapped shrimp, scallops, and the roasted garlic plate. That garlic plate does me in with the sauces and soft elephant garlic to spread on bread. Wow! I just wish they didn't put a tortillas on the bottom of every plate. The prices can be a little high but the dishes are delicious.   Parking is valet and happy hour is so-so.
One of the best meals I've had in a long time.. I will definitely return. Had to prime rib special it was outstanding

Finally made it into this great restaurant after hearing good things about it. The food was all good for all four in our party but the prices seamed too high and the service was a little inattentive. I plan to give it another try. I'll also dress a little nicer to blend with all the clientele that frequent the establishment.
Great food but the service is hit and miss sometimes.  Warning: No high chairs, so if you bring kids come prepared.

What an amazing dinner! Richardson's patio is beautiful. Protected from the elements, intimate and yet open and easy dining were tucked into quiet alcoves and booths. We ate at the bar serviced by an exceptional bartender.  The Hendrick's gin and tonic was cold and perfectly poured and the buttery Chardonnay by Landmark was an excellent suggestion. My husband had the Tortilla crusted halibut, and I selected the Pine nut crusted sea bass. The fish was a generous cut that was served at the perfect temperature - the sea bass was flaky and soft while the halibut was tender and firm. The sides were equally delicious with the right touch of Southwestern heat.   Perfect ambiance. Service was excellent and on point. The food innovative and delicious - a 5 star evening!
Terrible experience at Richardson's!     Uneducated, lazy, INEXPERIENCED people working here.   If you're going to charge families $80 - $100 to eat at your restaurant hire competent staff.

Loved this place so much, I wanted to stay for hours. Felt just like home. It's a very cozy restaurant, yet fancy and I love that. The waiter was very friendly. The food thou, it's delicious! Can't remember what I ordered but I'm pretty sure I will be ordering the same when I go back.
One of my favorite places. Not kid friendly, no high chairs. But beautiful setting and delicious food!

This was always our go to for brunch, lunch or dinner. But now we live in California, so don't get to go as often as we'd like.  We'd always choose to sit outside, being Phoenix the weather is always great and to be honest I think it's just far to dark inside.  My favorite is the double Pork Chop Chorizo. It's massive and will satisfy any hunger. Although I must admit last week while there half of the meat was far too undercooked. Asked for it medium but it was raw and I like my meat on the rarer side. I would've said something but I was completely full with what I'd eaten. That's the only time I wasn't 100% happy with my meal there.  If they have it, which sometimes they don't for some reason get the Mango Habenero sauce it's wonderful. Spicy but just so tasteful.  Nice atmosphere, a bit on the pricer side but I'll keep going back and I'm fussy about where I eat. Always a full house so you know they're doing something right.

I've been here many times after moving to the valley 2 years ago.  After having most of the dishes on the menu, I have to say that it's some of the best food that I have ever had. Any time that visitors are in town, this is where we go out to eat.  Love it, love it love it.

Perfect every time! From the $5 Mimosas/Bloody Marys to the  Huevos Ranchero! Definitely try the garlic plate it's delicious. Today I went for the fish trio. Mahi, Swordfish and scallops and washed it down with a Greyhound that's made with fresh grapefruit juice.

This place doesn't understand how to fix a bad situation.  Our friends got us a $50 gift card for Richardsons/Dicks/Rockerji for our wedding.  Two weeks later we went in for brunch at Richardsons, and were told there was only 18 dollars on it.  The manager said there was nothing they could do, but he'd look into it and get back with us. We heard nothing.  Two days later we called, and another manager said he knew nothing about this but would research it.  We heard nothing.  Again, we called and a third manager said it was the first time he heard of this and would look into it.  Finally someone called back and said they'd make it right - come on in and have dinner on them.   A day later someone calls and says the card was used a week after we got the card at Dick's Hideaway on a Monday (we have kids and haven't gone out on a Monday in years), but they'd still make it right.  We asked them if they had any video footage, because we didn't use the card, and would like to help them get to the bottom of this.  They never responded to this request, but said come in and we will make it right.   We decided to come in and take up their offer, only to be told the owner told the managers not to honor it.   A)it's concerning that they don't care that their gift cards are faulty or someone is stealing from them internally, and B) it's amazing that they decided not to make this right and fight us on this over $32.00.  UPDATE: After involving the BBB and the AG's office, they finally refunded the disputed amount.
Great service and fantastic food. I had the Carne Adovada and it was phenomenal. Great experience!

This is a New Mexico Mexican food restaurant. I liked hearing this when I first arrived. I personally do not care for spicy food and so it may not be fair for me to leave this review because just about everything on that menu did not sound appetizing to me. I did tell the server I did not like spice and was not given any alternative suggestions. The area we sat in was extremely cold all of us were shivering. Overall the food was alright. I did like the atmosphere. I'd go again but definitely would not be my first choice.

Tried this place one more time.  Sat outside in the bar area....much better!  The service was awesome and the food was fantastic.  We ordered several apps that we all very good and orders the stuff pork chops again...this dish is a must if you go there.  The margaritas were also really good.  I will go back again, but will definitely sit outside.

One of our favorite places!!!  Love the cozy atmosphere & how they replicated the old place to a T!  We love to take friends there because we know with out a doubt they will Love it!  There is something for everybody, seafood to mexican, to pizza(which is wonderful)  they have a wonderful happy hour if you are lucky enough to get a seat around the bar :)  And don't miss the chance to have the roasted garlic platter, it is to die for!  (just make sure everyone with you eats it too ;)  Easy to make a reservation on yelp so what are you waiting for?  Go NOW!

Review for Dick's Hideaway:  This place is called many things from Rokerij(y), Richardsons, and Dick's Hideaway. We went and grabbed breakfast and it was ok but pretty pricey for what we got. I was not a fan of the filet mignon breakfast or the way they do the beans on the tortillas but it was an ok experience. The next time we decided to try it for an early dinner but then decided to sit at the bar since happy hour is 5$ for appetizers(small plates). This is where the place really shines. The onion rings are the best I have had, The filet mignon skewers were excellent. The bacon wrapped shrimp were good but nothing to write about, but the prime ribsliders were top notch. We left with a small bill after a few drinks and some good food and vowed to go with friends again soon.  Go at happy hour and sample some small plates.

Definitely a must-try in Phoenix for New Mexican food with some unique twists.  The atmosphere is cool, but the staff can be hit-or-miss depending on who you get as your server or bartender.  Regardless, check it out for yourself for savory food and an authentic feel.
